Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: The1stFlyingKiwi
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel for US$60 on Hotwire.com and were more than happy with what we got for the price. The room was clean and modern, the location was perfect and the breakfast - although simple - was a pleasant addition considering the price. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, even offering us umbrellas to cope with the heavy rain outside. For this price I would definitely return - just wish we had booked for more than just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the Windy City!”
Reviews.Author: mercynurse62
Reviews.Content: On the north end of downtown, this hotel offers the perfect location for dining and entertainment with out the hassle of transportation-everything is in walking distance! A variety of restaurants and clubs are all within several blocks. The museums, parks and river are all a short bus ride away-take the 151 to get downtown. Staff is knowledgeable about the CTA (mass transit), directions and able to explain so that it's understandable to someone from out of town. I got a business card with the desk number in case I got lost or had questions-they told me to call if I needed help! They also let me know NOT to take one of the trips I'd planned as there was no stop in the immediate location I planned to visit. Full breakfast is available to get a good start on the day. Beds and linens are clean and comfy. Prices are reasonable. I loved my first visit to Chicago-I will return and I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Potential but lack of attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: Average little hotel with lots of potential. Great location friendly desk clerks. There has been extensive remodeling. However there is no attention to detail. The management is really lacking here. Breakfast was not up to normal Hoilday Inn Epxress standards. Although there has been updating damaged furniture carpet etc needs to be replaced. Door men sat in a room off the lobby and never made it out in time to help with luggage or open the doors, what good is that? Maid service let us know they were out of clean towels whens he cleaned our room but never brought any back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: uskern
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 2 nights. The room was beautiful furnished, but a little smallish. We loved the bathroom, it was quite spacious. The first night we had bad luck: There was a problem with the heating and in the morning we were down to 58 degrees F.... It was a general problem and it got solved the next day though. Breakfast was a bit a hassle. There's no proper breakfast room with tables and chairs but a lounge-like area with sofas and coffee tables. The buffet is a little small for so many people. Loved the pancakes-machine! Staff was friendly. Elevators were slow, had to wait quite a lot.

Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: Location: very good location, only two quarters to Magnificent Mile, 15 min walt to Loop and Millenium park. Room: small, but ok and clean. We had everything what we needed. Toiletries: shampoo, shower gel, hair conditioner. Free coffe, tee in the room. TV and hairdryer. Free Wi-Fi as Platinum member. Service: Important component of each hotel is its staff. Cass hotel has great staff. They are really friendly and helpful. Breakfast: tasty and enough choices. Very good! Come back there with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between Mag mile and La Salle in a perfect location. There are many hotels in the area but the prices will likely be higher. This is an utilitarian hotel, do not expect pampering here. At 85$/night it is great value downtown Chicago, including wifi and breakfast. Two blocks away from Grand station makes it easily accessible by public transit and with the traffic in Chicago usually congested you are better off avoiding the cabs from the airport (35 - 40 $ one way to Midway ). Keep in mind that there are two taxes charged by all hotels that total about 20% on top of the posted rate! I would say this hotel will give u a true taste of Chicago; lots of noise from emergency vehicles and drivers honking... with older hvac units there is that noise as well.... that being said bring ear plugs. Even so I still recommend this hotel for shopping trips,a family trip, a night out on the town or just a quick visit. Not so much for a romantic getaway...

Reviews.Title: “What can you expect?”
Reviews.Author: TheSteck
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located but that's about it. Free breakfast was good actually. Room tiny! I really took my cat and could not swing it!!! Funny old posters from The Cass Hotel give weekly rates of $10!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to HI Express standards”
Reviews.Author: Roscislaw
Reviews.Content: Front desk did not recognize Platinum status and did not offer any elite benefits. The clerk who checked me in and out was unfriendly and cold. I was given a room so tiny that my walk-in closet at home is bigger! Internet connection required re-logging in every time the laptop reawakened from hibernation, which was annoying and time-consuming. The queen bed was one of the worst I have slept in, totally unsupportive and with a deep sag in the middle. Bathroom amenities were poorly supplied with some items missing. The climate control system was very uncomfortable ... it was loud, and alternated between blowing hot and cold air which was very strange. Soundproofing in the room was very poor, and noises from the street and from the hallway were both clearly and disturbingly audible. Breakfast was indifferent, they were out of hot water for tea, the omelets had been sitting in the chafing-dish for so long that they were leathery, and the bananas were bruised and over-ripe. The only good thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwipaul_8
Reviews.Content: very nice desk staff at arrival and check in very easy,room and bathroom very good.hotel is a older 1 but i thought it was just fine.hotel is about 2 blocks from the mag mile,so there is heaps of shops close by and more places to eat than u can poke a stick at.recommmend chilles around the corner.breakfast was good with a egg choice thru to grits,potatoes and meats and ceral,youghurt and pancakes. had a good 2 night stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, small city rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo_Bruce
Reviews.Content: This is a city hotel. A rebranded historical hotel in downtown Chicago. Formally known as the Cass Hotel (that what all the cabbies call it), it is a 1920 hotel with the small room you would expect for something built during that period. The staff was outstanding , desk staff greated people by name, bell men were always around to hail a cab or take a bag, the housekeeping staff always said hello and smiled. Every request during my 5 day stay was met with a smile. For a older hotel the breakfast space was ample, and due to the location it seconds for a relaxing lounge space. If you have a group this would be the place to meet, the rooms are too small for guest to hang out comfortably. Food was hot and on schedule. They are having issues with the key cards. Many guest including myself had to have keys remade several times. I hope they fix this soon. It might be worth calling before booking if this would be a real inconvenience for you trip. Location could not be better. Just a few blocks north of the river, there is many options for food and drink. Catch the Second City History of Chicago show in old town. The hotel is two blocks from the red line. Using the subway it is less than 10 minutes from the door to inside the loop. The few homeless are found a couple of blocks south toward the loop area. It is customary in the area to have your left over boxed up and pass them to the homeless on your walk home. Just meet their eye and they will politely ask you if you have leftovers. I always received a warm thank you for my generosity. Parking is a bit expensive, $40 valet, and $39 self park. Taxi from the airport is only $38 and the blue line is only $5. So unless you need a car, donâ€™t bring one. I parked in a lot on the west side of the river for only $10 per day, but itâ€™s a 3/4 mile walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DanielleDurham_NC
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference and decided to go in a day early. I was not able to book a room at the "conference" hotel so I picked the Holiday Inn Express. I wish I did not have to leave! I must admit the room was very small (I have traveled a lot to Europe so I know small hotels), but this room had everything you needed! Plus no one should be in their room because they should be out seeing the sights. The staff was very helpful and the place was clean. The best part was the location! I can't wait to go back! I forgot to mention that the rate I received was much lower than the Hampton Inn or similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and staff !”
Reviews.Author: Lido1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Cass on January 19, for 4 nights in corner room 1508. I`m Platinum Ambassador within Priority Club and was very impressed with their treatment of me and my status. I originally booked a queen room but requested a king on my reservation. When I checked in, the lady at the front desk recognized my status, welcomed me and addressed me by my last name, upgraded me to a corner king room and in addition credited my account 2500 bonus points just for being platinum. The hotel itself is completely renovated and everything has a new look. The room is very high tech, huge TV, lots of outlets, night-reading lamps on the bed, brand new carpet, wonderful high-pressure shower head and even a safe. Service was exceptional especially considering that it`s only a Holiday Inn Express. It rivals the full service hotels and even better than most of them. From valet to front desk to housekeeping and breakfast attendants, everyone seemed ready to help and always smiled and greeted me with good morning and have a great day. The head valet guy always opened the door for everyone coming in and going out of the hotel. And of course, free WI FI and full hot breakfast is included which is a great value. There are two elevators and they are fast and efficient. Valet parking is $40 (in and out privileges) and is very competitive considering that most surrounding hotels charge at least $45 or $50. If you want great value, a clean and modern boutique hotel, at a great location and with courteous and professional staff, the Cass Holiday Inn Express is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Prof1944
Reviews.Content: The service was not atypical of most Holiday Inn Express hotels, but the staff was unusally accommodating. I highly recommend this place. It is also at most a 15 min. walk from most anything site, restaurant, or shopping area downton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, but rooms are on the small side.”
Reviews.Author: christie m
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location was fantastic, the front desk staff was helpful and the rooms were quiet. The only downfall would be the rooms are pretty narrow and if u are sharing a room with another person it starts to feel pretty crowded. It is Chicago, so in all honesty it wasn't a big deal because all I wanted to do was get ready and go out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Not for Families”
Reviews.Author: SpreeBee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 12 month old daughter. I may have had a more positive review of this hotel if it had just been the two of us. The hotel looks great. The outside is nice and everything inside is very clean. My only issue with the ground floor is there's 6 steps to get from the front door to the lobby and elevators. There's no ramp to get the stroller up; I had to get help from either my husband or the doorman if he were available every time. They do have a wheelchair lift that I remember, should there be someone who needed assistance. For me, it was just a huge pain. Check-in was easy and they even gave us a pack and play. All of the staff over our entire 4 day stay were very friendly. The room was nice and clean. It would have been a great room if we didn't have a baby with us. It was too tiny for our family. We had to set up the pack and play in the hallway next to the door and the bathroom. Also, we had a ton of noise from the hallway. I'm not sure if it was a particularly loud group of people (they were shouting) or if the walls are that thin. The bathroom was kinda small, but serviceable and clean. There was a coffee pot in the room and a nice flat-screen TV, but no fridge or anything. There was also a nice little bench seat that gave it a cozy feel. Breakfast was good. There were quite a few tables, but they were kinda busy and not many empty ones. They had a good mix of hot and cold things. Over all, I would stay here again if I wanted to save money by not staying on Michigan Ave. Although it was small for a family, I think it would have been great for a couple or for close friends who didn't mind sharing the space.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: bradgate2
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is an excellent choice for a good value hotel in downtown Chicago. The hotelâ€™s location is ideal, one block from the metro station and two from the magnificent mile. A wide choice of shops, restaurants and nightlife are all within walking distance. Rooms are small by American standards with no fridge, but are comfortable and well maintained with good beds, bathrooms and air conditioning. The staff are friendly, professional and very helpful. The only negative about this hotel is the breakfast arrangements. The breakfast on offer is good, but there is a shortage of seating in the breakfast area, so you can find yourself with nowhere to sit and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get 'guaranteed' room”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerJJ
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the price is less than I have ever paid. I visit Chicago several times each year (for the past 20 years) and stay at the Palmer House where I have always received exceptional service. Because I wanted to be closer to Northwestern Memorial this trip, I chose the Cass. I paid the higher price online so I would be guaranteed the room I chose. However, when we arrived, they did not have our room. We were stuck in a smoking, handicapped accessible room. It smelled horrible. Because the shower head was hung to be appropriate for someone in a wheelchair (it could be moved, but the rubber was worn, so it wouldn't stay in place), it was impossible to shower without creating a huge mess (everything soaked). We were told we would be moved the next day. We were not. Nor were we given a courtesy call to explain why. When I questioned this, the staff member was rude claiming she had called (there were no messages). The breakfast buffet is convenient, but the seating is limited. Many guests did not have a table. If you plan to workout, the exercise room has a capacity of about 4, so plan to go very early. The parking garage has some sort of alarm which we heard going off and on all night. We left with stinky hair and clothes, but we did get half off our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy rooms and crappy fixtures”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tiny rooms. Table and room color combo reminded me of a jail cell I'd seen on TV. Heating starts with a loud thud and stops with a thud. Faucet moved around; toilet seat moved around. Location and breaker only positives. The cleaning people seemed to take up the entire floor the entire day, every day. What the hell were they doing all that time? No idea. Never seen that before. Most HD channels didn't work most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Light Up Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: maripotter
Reviews.Content: Great location! Can't beat it if you want to be close to most of what the city has to offer! You are within walking distance to SO much! Rooms are tiny. We laughed pretty hard when we arrived, but who spends very much time in the room when you are in the City! Walls are kinda thin too... Overall, it's a great place to hang your hat after a night on the town!

Reviews.Title: “Internet is VERY slow”
Reviews.Author: Aaron H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, rooms are small as to be expected downtown Chicago, but the internet access is about the slowest I've seen with www.speedtest.net results 0.35 Mb/s download 0.24 Mb/s upload. (Cable internet can go up to 60 Mb/s and even my old Droid one 3G phone was 1.531 Mb/s)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: stanloise
Reviews.Content: Originally known as just Cass Hotel is perfectly located on N Wabash Ave, just two blocks away from Mag Mile and State street. I found this hotel to be perfectly located amidst business centres and shopping streets, as i was busy at work - my wife could spend the day at shopping on state st & mag mile. The breakfast here is also awesome, they have a buffet breakfast with loads of healthy stuff to keep you going all day long specially if you are in Chicago on a business visit and have less time for a bite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and great service!”
Reviews.Author: CaliKelli77
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel over the past weekend. It was my first trip to Chicago and I couldn't have picked a better location! The hotel was modern, clean and comfortable! Furthermore, the staff goes above and beyond! I would definitely reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Holiday Inn Express I've Seen”
Reviews.Author: NatalieIU
Reviews.Content: For full disclosure, I was able to book this hotel with points and it was for my bachelorette party - so it was free and for a very fun weekend, which probably made my stay better than my normal work travel. With that said, I highly recommend this hotel. For starters, it's in an exceptional area downtown - walking distance to so much and right across the street from a Trader Joe's. The interior is nicely decorated and the hotel staff was very kind and fun (shout out to Takisha!). The actual rooms were a bit cramped but we spend all of about 5 hours in the room, so it was not an issue. Probably the best suprise was that they had a pancake maker for breakfast. I've stayed at several Holiday Inn Express hotels for business travel and I've never seen a pancake maker! Hey, it's the little things, right?

Reviews.Title: “Location is great - Rooms are very small.”
Reviews.Author: Bianca666
Reviews.Content: The location first of all is great. Walking distance to all the attractions and great restaurants and bars. If you dont plan on staying in the room very much, like we did, it's great. However the rooms although they are nice and contemporary, they are very small and feel a little cramped. The staff is super nice and very friendly. Overall it's a great place to stay if you're gonna be out and about most of the time anyway.

Reviews.Title: “So so experience”
Reviews.Author: dgm999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business, one night, extremely small rooms, bed, enough room to walk around it to desk, small bathroom and closet, for 159$ you should expect more. This place is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: ninernationmom
Reviews.Content: We stay here on business whenever we are in Chicago. Negatives: Rooms are very small. Closet space is minimal, especially for two people. No room to store luggage out of the way. Room service is a bit unorganized - sometimes you get fresh towels, sometimes you don't. They'll pick up the dirty ones but don't leave new ones. Heat/AC is on a motion detector, which means if you're not up moving around, it doesn't come on. Makes it difficult to sleep thru the night without getting too warm on hot weather days. POSITIVES: Hotel staff has been nothing but pleasant to us. Nice to receive greetings upon returning at end of the day. Breakfast is good and the breakfast area is spacious and also makes a nice place to gather in the evenings with coworkers. Location is VERY convenient to local transportation, restaurants, and shopping on Michigan Ave. I felt safe walking by myself.

Reviews.Title: “A few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: bob_carroll74
Reviews.Content: I slept there for 8 nights, while in Chicago for work... the problem with Holiday inns is that you know what to expect... so the unexpected things you notice are normally negative. This hotel is one of such cases. The rooms are standard holiday inn, with a 70's twist. However: 1) The two elevators are most certainly not enough to carry all the people when the hotel is full. It took us 15 minutes to get from the 11th floor to the lobby, and another 15 to go back up with our coffees. 2) Some days the hot water was not working (we got a discount for that at the checkout). Still, taking a cold shower before going to work is not that nice... 3) The cleaning staff is very confused with the towels! Sometimes they leave them on the bed, sometimes they don't even fold the ones that I left on the rack in the bathroow... 4) The rooms and the closet space are really small!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good deal”
Reviews.Author: M&M's1
Reviews.Content: Room-small rooms, but updated decoration. Room was clean and functional. Wish it had a fridge. Location- excellent location. Easy access to public transportation. Parking lot next door. Trader joes across the street was very convenient. Good deal for the price, booked this for the price, location, and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Room service is not that professional”
Reviews.Author: Wang75
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great. However, the room service is poor. The room service staff occupied the lift in the morning at busy hours, and some of the guests had to go by staircase in order to catch the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small but modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ms_angelita
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with small but renovated rooms. Free breakfast. Nice area with a lot of restaurants and walking distance to many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, great breakfast, nice service”
Reviews.Author: dgeronimopo
Reviews.Content: rooms mybe not the big, its an old building renowed, it has great lobby, with coffe and hot chocolate all the time ( great for chicago ), walking distance from michigan avenue. really nice staff. a good place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Service from Upper Management.”
Reviews.Author: lvella2008
Reviews.Content: The location was great, including the Continental Breakfast. However, the service was the worst I've ever seen as a frequent traveler. DO NOT deal with the hotel manager, Sean, he needs to brush up on his customer service skills. After not having the correct number of beds upon arrival, the hotel promised a roll-a-way bed, needless to say, that bed never came...so our party ended up getting split up on multiple floors since they were not able to meet our needs for two queen beds (there was only 3 of us). We played "room tag" for most of the weekend. After requesting a partial refund for our annoyance and inconvenience, they told us since we booked our trip on a third-party website (expedia, hot wire, etc.) they were not able to do ANYTHING for us. Not to mention, we had a huge storm our last night which ended up canceling continental breakfast for the entire hotel. Oh, it was also really fun carrying our luggage down 11 floors since the elevators broke as well. Price is great, but if you can afford a BETTER hotel, please do. Managing service is terrible. I've been to Chicago over twenty times and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price”
Reviews.Author: janeWaterlooOntario
Reviews.Content: Our room was extremely small. Basically one of us had to sit on the bed in order for the other one to move around the room! My husband quoted Rodney Dangerfield: "Our room was so small, we had step outside to change our mind!!" We had a queen bed room, I would recommend asking for a corner room as these appeared much larger on the blueprint on our door. However, the location is amazing, a short walk to the Magnificent Mile and Millenium Park. The cost is exceptionally reasonable for Chicago, especially when you consider that a free, substantial breakfast is included. Staff are enthusiastic and helpful. I would definitely stay here if you are in Chicago to see the sights and want a clean, comfortable room for showering and sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “It was like sleeping in a closet”
Reviews.Author: toddmato
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and beds are very uncomfortable.. People are nice and beakfast was great..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cass Holiday Inn Express Tight Squeeze”
Reviews.Author: Harvlis
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I stayed at the Hotel Cass Holiday Inn Express. We had a double queen room. The Hotel is clean and the staff is friendly but, the rooms were as small as can possibly be. To give you an idea, you couldn't put the toilet seat down, with a full roll of toilet paper, as it was that close to the bowl. The bathroom floor towel was small and could barely fit between the toilet and the wall. There was one small shelf in the bathroom. The sink was a unique style but, it was backed up. Shower pressure and heat was fine. The room had a tight closet with six hangers and a small three draw metal cabinet. There was free internet service in the room but, there was no refrigerator. They did have night lights on each side of each bed, which was nice and the AC unit worked wonderfully. The gym offered a bench and some dumbbells, along with a bicycle, treadmill, and elliptical machine. The hotel serves complimentary breakfast and is across the street from a Starbucks. I won't stay here again, as the room was way too small. With all of the options in Chicago, no need to be cramped.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: slourash
Reviews.Content: Just to get it out of the way - yes, the rooms at this hotel are small just like everyone says. I think that the location and the amazing service more than make up for it though. I know this is a Holiday Inn Express but the service is 5 Star (the legacy of the Hotel Cass perhaps?). Aziz in particular stands out in my mind, but everyone was great - from accommodating an early check in, hailing cabs, holding our bags after check out, opening the door, giving directions - and everyone with a positive attitude and a smile on their face. Location is in a good neighborhood (traveled with my 12 year old nieces & felt very safe walking). We were close to shops, Red line train station, restaurants, etc. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel management”
Reviews.Author: daisyluna
Reviews.Content: When I planned a trip to Chicago, I reserved rooms under my husband's credit card. When my parents and I arrived to the hotel, I asked a person at the front desk whether if they can charge room fees under my parent's credit card and they said it will be fine. Thus, I called the hotel when I found out they charged hotel fees to my husband's bank account. First day, they simply transferred my phone calls to their account manager office and I left a message. Second day, they transferred my phone calls to their account manager office again and told me they would leave him a message. Certainly, I left a message again. Fourth day, with no phone calls and no e-mails, I called the hotel again. The person at the front desk explained that they charged my husband's card because it was prepaid. The reason they took my parent's credit card was to charge extra cost such as damage of the room. They simply will not do anything to the money which they took from my husband's bank account. Even though the person aplogized this circumstances, I wonder why it took 4 days to explain the situation. In addition, I wonder why the person at the front desk did say they can charge room fees under my parents' credit card. She did neither mention about prepaid under my husband's credit card nor extra charges under my parent's credit card. It was a nice hotel, but I would not go back to stay there again. After all, there are more better hotels in Chicago for sure.

Reviews.Title: “First great hotel stay in ages!”
Reviews.Author: tcebanks
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my last afternoon/night here in this hotel and while I'm checking my mail using the free computer/internet/printer services offered thought I'd write a review. I booked online (directly though the hotel's website) and got the best rate online I could find for this hotel for a non-smoking room/queen bed (total cost was about US$640 for 4 nights) There is a great complimentary breakfast wi9th so many great options that are actually pretty good! (Sausages, bacon biscuits n' gravy, cheese/ham ommlettes, muffins, bagels, milk, yogurt, coffee, juices, fresh fruit-I don't think I ever seen this many breakfast options in a hotel like this. The staff are friendly and so extremely helpful and made it look effortless as they spent quite a bit of time explaining how to get where I wanted to go (never getting me lost once!) The room was small but adequate for the purpose of my trip and was always well cleaned upon my return at the end of each day. The walls seem a little thin as I was the 1st room closest to the elevator and got to hear the passerby in the hall-maybe just ask for a room furthest from the elevator :) (The AC was a little noisy, closet space for clothes a little tight and some of the TV channels did not work -but as the bed was so comfortable and I had a nice little window view, it was no inconvenience to me at all) (I didn't ask but I didn't/maybe notice a little hair dryer or hair conditioner so guests may want to pack these items) With it's great central location to shops, restaurants and activities, it's easy to get around with the Red line close by and everything virtually in walking distance (Yet another reason not to worry about the hotel room. (There's an ATM on the ground floor (didn't use it though) and a newspaper at your door each weekday morning. I really enjoyed my stay here and this will be the hotel I stay in every time I return to Chicago-I really don't want to check out tomorrow morning as it's been the first GREAT hotel stay I've had in ages!! (The manager, Jackie is fabulous and the supporting front desk staff like Kelly are delightful!)

Reviews.Title: “An above average HIE”
Reviews.Author: Ant4fatony
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a reward stay only because the Crowne Plaza was full. So I was not looking forward to it. We were greeted into the tiny lobby by both a very polite doorman and host. The midwestern hospitality was nice after coming in from California. Being Platinum member we were told we were "upgraded". The room was very small and looked into a brick alley from the 6th floor. You have to remember that this was an old hotel that has been converted. The room was spotless. The hotel is sort of a boutaue design rather than an HIE. The decorating was not my taste, but it was clean and new. We seemed to miss breakfast every morning as we slept in, however we took advantage of the coffee service. Wifi was spotty, but I used the busines center. There are a few experiences that stood out that made this a great hotel: 1. Amazing location! A few blocks from the Magnificent Mile, tons of restaurants. This place was better placed than the Crowne Plaza. 2. Very polite staff, we never had to open the front door or hail a car by ourselves. Neat to have a doorman at an HIE. 3. They held out luggage the day we checked out before our flight. 4. On the last day it rained and they gave us a large umbrella to take shopping. Overall it was a pleasant suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: eletnahc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel very recently. It has excellent location; walking distance from the Mag Mile and close to several restaurants and fast food joints. The breakfast is nothing to write home about but it is sufficient. The hotel has two lifts but there are 16 floors and if you are on a lower floor, the elevator gets quite full depending on the time of day. The area is great with several restaurants and fast food joints within walking distance. The plus points are complimentary breakfast and wifi. Also, we found the bed very comfortable not one of the really soft mattresses that you sink into! The staff were very polite and helped us identify the touristy spots to visit. Check the rates in advance as it tends to get expensive over the weekend. We would return if we got better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel overall, but too expensive and service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu4761
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Hotel Cass Holiday Inn Express over the weekend to celebrate a 21st birthday. We chose this hotel because one person in the group booked his room through an opaque site and paid about $120 a night. Booking through the Holiday Inn website, the same room was $206 a night before tax (and that was the discounted, noncancelable, prepay-in-advance rate). So one of the rooms was a great deal and the other two were on the expensive side. We were left with a bad impression of the hotel before we even arrived when one member of our group was double-charged for her room (she had paid in advance). When she saw the extra charge on her credit card account and called the hotel, the person she spoke to was totally uninteresting in helping her, told her that the hotel didn't have any record of the extra charge, and advised her to dispute the charge with her credit card company. She did that and got it removed, but I thought it was extremely poor customer service for the hotel to make a mistake and then tell her it wasn't their job to fix it. The property itself was very nice, and the location was excellent. After reading the reviews others have posted, here are my thoughts: the rooms are definitely small, but tolerable. I doubt many people stay here just to stay in their rooms all day anyway. The decor is very modern and up-to-date, and I liked that the hotel had character and wasn't just a cookie-cutter Holiday Inn. I know others have complained about noise, both from other rooms and outside, but IMHO it wasn't a problem. Our room was on the side of the hotel near the garage door that beeps every time it opens, but I don't recall hearing the alarm from inside the room. The front desk staff who checked us in were very friendly and welcoming, so it seems that this hotel does have good employees; the guy who wasn't at all interested in resolving the double-charge just isn't one of them, I guess. I was offered a late checkout which we didn't end up needing (regular checkout is noon, which was great). I used the valet service, which at $40 a day was expensive...but then again, what do you expect for parking in downtown Chicago? I did see that the nearby parking garage charged $33 a day for self-parking, so you won't save too much by doing it yourself. Also, the hotel valet service includes in-and-out privileges. The valet guys were friendly and reasonably quick. As for cleanliness, we had no complaints except one that was pretty inexcusable. One of our friends found nail clippings in his ice bucket. I don't know how the hotel reacted when he complained, but regardless - that's disgusting. In general, I'd recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal on it. To me, it was a bit lacking for $206 a night. But the location is great and it's not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome staff, small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Enckellen
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid for this location it's an awesome hotel. You can walk to tons of attractions from this hotel! Valet service is very quick and easy. It's $4 more to valet park, with 24 hr in and out privileges. If you self park you cannot go in and out without paying an additional fee. As others have stated the rooms are small, but for my husband and I it was perfect. If you are planning on being out in the city most of the day it's the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE QUARTERS AT THE HOTEL CASS”
Reviews.Author: WVTravelers6166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a bus tour of Chicago, so The Hotel Cass/Holiday Inn Express was chosen for us. The hotel is located within walking distance of Michigan Avenue and many shops. The Navy Pier is also close by. The hotel may be a great place to stay for people who like to shop, but be aware that you might not have much room to store your purchases once you get back to your room. Iâ€™m glad that I read the reviews of this hotel before I arrived or I would have been surprised by the size of our room. The other reviewers of this hotel are not lying, Folks! These rooms are QUITE small. Itâ€™s about the size of a college dorm room with barely large enough space for two people to move around. I cannot imagine having a family of four staying in one room. We spent two nights in this hotel and it was enough. Our room had a small built-in couch where we had to put our suitcase because there was nowhere else to put it. Iâ€™m certainly glad we only had one suitcase. The closet was small and included a knee-high metal dresser inside. With the dresser taking up most of the area in the closet, there was very little space left to hang up any clothes. The bathroom had a tiny shelf over the sink, but it was barely wide enough to hold a tube of toothpaste, a toothbrush and a comb. Most of the time, my stuff ended up falling into the sink. Sure while on vacation, people spend most of their time out and about seeing the sights, but when I come back to a hotel after a long day, I would like to have a little bit of breathing room. I felt as if my husband and I were constantly climbing over each other. When we first got into our room, it was very warm. I tried to adjust the air conditioner, but it seemed to be broken. I called the front desk and within ten minutes a maintenance man came to check on the problem. It turned out to be nothing more than a flipped breaker. I quickly discovered, however, why the air conditioner had been turned off. The system made a loud rattling noise which woke me up every time the system started or stopped. Even though our room was on the 11th floor, I got very little sleep during our two-night stay. There was constant noise from the street--late-night horn blowing and women yelling outside the hotel at 3:00 a.m. I have been to New York City on several occasions and the noise in Times Square isnâ€™t as loud as what I encountered during my stay at The Hotel Cass. I liked the modern dÃ©cor of our room and we had a nice view of The Hancock Building from our window. The hotel is clean, the staff is very nice and helpful, but I would not stay here again if my husband and I were traveling by ourselves. The rooms are just too small and the constant city traffic noise can be quite annoying when trying to sleep. If you donâ€™t mind city noise or small rooms than this hotel is perfectly fine. I have travelled to Chicago several times, so I know that there are roomier and quieter hotels to be found within the friendly confines of The Windy City. My advice is to do some research of other hotels before you make your decision to stay at this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: MarfAtlanta
Reviews.Content: It's a renovated property, and although the rooms are small, they are clean and attractive. We had two adults and two tweens in one room and were very comfortable. The location is only blocks away from the Mag Mile, train, Trader Joe's grocery, and great restaurants - we ate at Pizza Due and Weber's Grill. The breakfast in the morning was very convenient, and I have to say that the guy stocking all the drinks and food never let the smile leave his face even though there were crowds of people in the way. Housekeeping was a little loud in the morning, but the porters and doormen were exceptionally helpful and polite. I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd return without question”
Reviews.Author: CostaRicaBirder
Reviews.Content: We'd been to Chicago before and had gotten to know the town. On our previous visit, we'd picked a hotel that seemed like a deal, and was located just southwest of the loop on the Chicago River. It wasn't bad, just in the wrong place. This trip, we decided to stay where we'd spent the most time in our first trip -- Streeterville. Searching on-line, we found the former Hotel Cass, now a Holiday Inn Express. The price and location were good. We booked a week. Now six days into our stay, we're very satisfied. The location is superb - train, bus, Michigan Avenue, Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, Chicago River, Hancock Tower, etc. The daily free breakfast is quite adequate with a fair choice of food. The staff is unfailingly cheerful and helpful. The only downside, which you can read about in many reviews, is the room size. Pretty cramped, but commensurate with the price we paid. No complaints. I'd recommend strongly to those who want to get out and see Chicago, and not spend their days in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Monkey Show - Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: lynn0000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding with a friend. I had originally booked my own room but cancelled it when we decided to share. He turned in his suit for dry cleaning the day before the wedding and was assured he would have it back by 8am the day of the wedding. When it wasn't available by 10am, we were told they were not sure where the suit was. Finally he got the suit back around 3pm - AFTER the wedding was over. There were no apologies or offers to fund a suit rental, and he had to completely miss the wedding - the whole point of us being there. Weeks later i discovered my credit card had been billed for the room I cancelled, and after 2 days of repeat phone calls I was finally able to talk to finance, who said they had no record of my credit card at all. Finally after making them check the number 3 times, their system did find that I had been billed and they said they would refund my money. During this time no one was very apologetic or sympathetic, and there were no offers to attempt to make things right, comp the room, or anything. Very disappointing and a stain on the Holiday Inn Express name, which I had always been a fan of. Oh and the rooms are very small/bathrooms are cramped/elevators are scary and small/the two beds were different sizes/walls are paper thin/they charge hotel guests for parking - but those would have all been forgiven had the service not been horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kclmp89
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location from Michigan Ave, had great staff, and a wonderful continental breakfast! Stayed in a room with a queen bed, definitely very limited floor space. However, with a great location, breakfast, and staff the small rooms are a ok!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, tight rooms.”
Reviews.Author: efm16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in the heart of the downtown/MI Ave area, so if that is where you are looking to be, it is GREAT. The rooms are rather tight, as this is an old building that has been turned into a hotel. The rooms are nicely styled though, even they are like cruise ship or smaller size (when they say 2 people only in a room, they really mean it!!). I didn't love the bed in the room we were in this time, just not too comfortable, and we were on an outside wall, which left everything REALLY noisy outside. The breakfast was very nice in the Holiday Inn Express style. They just added a workout room, which is a nice option as well, even if it is a limited workout room. Valet parking is a flat fee for in and out, which in Chicago, is a pretty good way to go, even though it isn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value for money, great staff, location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: IvannaGF
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that suits every need for me: staff efficient and helpful, internet worked perfectly in rooms, rooms are not spacious but this was not a problem, they are still comfortable. They are nicely decorated and very modern. Breakfast is really full. The hotel is very clean and well kept. The location is just perfect, 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue, near shops, restaurants and supermarkets. I really loved this hotel, my experience was the best one. 100% recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Kat333
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but very small. We were only spending the night so it wasn't bad. Breakfast was good. We paid an extra $40 to valet park. It was worth it. If you go to Chicago make sure you visit the the Weber Grill Restaurant. We paid $139. for the night. We thought that was pretty good for being in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: khl123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn Express for my Anniversary and sadly was not very impressed. Although the location was perfect, as we were having dinner on Michigan Ave., the staff was not friendly at all. When we checked in the lobby was messy and there were boxes on the floor and they had Starbuck's cups behind the counter that were visible. When we went to our rooms I was very surprised by how small they were, but it was doable we were just sleeping anyways. Later that night I was walking through the room and stepped on what seemed to be a piece of class. It hurt and I was bleeding. Right away they were at our door with bandaids and a key to a new room. They were very apologetic but that really bothered me that there was glass on the floor. The breakfast was not good at all and was cold when we got there. I also don't think the rooms were as clean as they could have been.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Nice”
Reviews.Author: Superfoodiemoodie
Reviews.Content: Great location, it is close to every important places in Chicago and rooms are clean. This hotel has wonderful staff and it has almost everything a business traveler could need. Very good experience. Bottom: Rooms are extremely small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sadie4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. First night was on second floor and had strong smell of cigarette smoke coming into room. Apparently smoking floor was on 3rd floor. complained and was given another room immediately. The staff could not have been nicer throughout the entire visit. Breakfast was very good and quite a variety every morning. Agree with other reviewers that rooms are small but it didn't matter as we were never in them except to sleep. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, reasonably priced in dowtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: c0sm0p0litana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business so did not really care for appeal. I found it reasonably priced considering its location (downtown). However if you drive and use their valet parking it can becomes expensive ($40/day for valet parking). I do recommend parking at nearby lots. I asked for a high floor because of the view (which was great). The room was very small but sufficient size. It had all the basics (desk w/ computer hook up), small but clean bathroom, flat screen TV. All the basics were there and OK and it was clean. That's what I cared about. The front desk was friendly. I was there around Eastern and was offered candy when I checked out (nice gesture). However I did have to wait more than 10 min (close to 20 min to get my car by valet).

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, well located and higher standard than you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: olivermankowski
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. The rooms were a touch small, but HD TV and free wifi compensated! Ask for a mid-height of the building room looking out over Wabash and you will get some great views. The location is fantastic, and the staff and Concierge very helpful, offering maps, guidance and free baggage holding (without demanding tips for once!) Bathrooms were decent, and the breakfast (included in ours for free) was a wide range of bagels, muffins, drinks and cooked - very good for a USA hotel. Big Bowl and Gino's pizzeria nearby well recommended for food, and The Hunt bar about 10 blocks north if you're looking to meet young professionals in the evening and reasonably priced drinks. Incidentally Chicago is the best USA city, especially for cosmopolitan/European approach and much friendlier than NY, and I've been to them all. Cost around Â£90/night

Reviews.Title: “Much better than average HI express - go for twin room!”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers complain about the size of the rooms, I opted for the â€“ ever so slightly â€“ more expensive but larger twin room. The only thing that surprised me eventually was the HI Express sign and the final invoice. This hotel is a delightful place to stay, and can easily compete with upmarked alternatives (read: with much more expensive hotels). Extremely friendly and helpful staff, fresh looks all over, free breakfast, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: shannon50
Reviews.Content: I will keep it short and simple. Overall, we had a pretty fair experience with this hotel. We got the room from Travelzoo for $70 a night which was a steal. I think the cleaning staff could use some improvement which is my biggest complaint about the hotel. The hotel it self is not dirty I just think the cleaning crew doesn't do the best job. Pros: *Location is perfect. Just close enough to Michigan Avenue but far enough that the street noise isn't an issue. *Included breakfast which is always nice. *Got it for a song on Travelzoo. *Customer service really good. Corrected problems promptly and with a smile. Cons: *A little below my standards of cleanliness. Some small stains on the sheets. When we discovered them at 11 at night someone came to the room quickly and was happy to change it for us. *Noise can for sure be an issue if you are a light sleeper. *Rooms are small but no smaller than a typical hotel room in a downtown metropolitan area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not plan on getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: Shirleysgirl
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our experience. We typically enjoy staying at Holiday Inn Express. Our room was very clean but it was incredibly small. The four of us could hardly move around. A family with small children and all of the neccesary items would never be able to manage in a room that small. The beds were horrible! The mattresses were very soft and worn out. You could hear every sound in the motel and outside. The bathtub/shower was raised by about 4 inches. So be prepared. It is a very big step up and back out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaBulldog
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at Hotel Cass Holiday Inn Express and had an enjoyable visit. We arrived on an early flight and went straight to the hotel to drop our bags. By the time we strolled down the street and had breakfast our room was ready. That was great news since we were tired from the early flight. The rooms were small but we had a corner room and from the reviews here on TA I guess those are bigger. The only downside was the walls were paper thin and the outside noise was awful (parking garage across the street buzzed constantly) so I would bring a fan or something to drown out the noise. The location was excellent, breakfast was tasty and the service was outstanding. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeStu
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of it all, had a great stay here at a fraction of the price compared to the surrounding hotels. The rooms are small, but well decorated and very cozy. Nice included breakfast as well. I will be staying here for any future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great value, a Euro style boutique hotel ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyoasis42
Reviews.Content: I agree with Colmiri, great location, the ambiance of a European boutique hotel, great value on Hotwire, professional, friendly, attentive staff. Rooms are small but decorated nicely with a retro, trendy, updated look. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, great staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a week at this property, and I can highly recommend it. From check-in to check-out all the staff were exceedingly friendly - nothing seemed to be too much trouble, and everyone from door men to housekeeping all seemed keen to ensure things were just right during your stay. The dÃ©cor and layout of this hotel makes it somewhat unique amongst the normally cookie-cutter Holiday Inn Express chain - yes it's an old building, but that gives it some charm. The rooms are small/compact, but no more so than I've experienced in other cites such as New York. There are only two elevators, which means it can sometimes take a while for your call to be answered during busy periods (such as breakfast etc), but again that's to be expected in a property of this kind - it's unfortunate, but you have to be realistic. I loved the room decor, and the flat-screen TV. The bathroom was also nice, and the shower powerful. The free and functioning internet was also useful! The breakfast selection was pretty typical for this chain, with fruit, yoghurt, cereal, pastries. bagels and hot dishes (varying selections of omelettes, scrambled egg, bacon, sausage patties, biscuits, gravy depending on the day) with juices, teas and coffees - it was more than sufficient to start the day. The cinnamon buns are a definite recommendation. The location, right off the Magnificent Mile is superb, with tons places to eat, drink and shop. Combined with excellent transit routes, it meant that Chicago was pretty much at your fingertips. If you don't feel like eating out, check out Trader Joes across the street, or Jewel-Osco a block away for some cheap eat in options/snacks/sodas. One small thing which made me smile: the soda machine on the 2nd floor charged $1.50 for a 20oz bottle. Why I smiled? It was cheaper than the local stores. It's nice to see a hotel not gouge it's customers for the sake of convenience. I'd stay here again without hesitation, and I'd also recommend this property to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff are so rude. So rude!"”
Reviews.Author: alwaystravelling1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the free breakfast is adequate (although if you like to eat healthy, you can't). The rooms are smaller than NYC hotel rooms. I have to stay here as the company books this hotel. They need to train their front desk staff to be polite, not roll their eyes when guests ask for something simple.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel--will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: kkb618
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The staff was very helpful and polite. I called the day we were arriving to see what types of bed was in the room because one of my cousin's friends was coming for the night. I asked if they could switch it to a double bed and that was not a problem. The room was small, but it wasn't a problem as we just slept in there. The beds were okay. I don't sleep well in hotel beds, so that's just my opinion. Each bed comes with 4 pillows- 2 soft and 2 firm. Elevators were kind of slow, but it was a busy hotel so it was expected. Continental breakfast was very yummy! Eggs, bacon, cereal, juice, muffins, fruit, yogurt, cinnamon rolls, etc. DEFINITELY TRY THE CINNAMON ROLLS! Computers in the breakfast room were fast, high speed internet in the room was kind of slow. Location was PERFECT!! 2 blocks away from Michigan Avenue and 1 block away from State Street. Surrounded by good restaurants and Starbucks is right across the street! Didn't use valet parking so I can't review that part, but the staff was always willing to hail a taxi for you! The view was also pretty good! Easy and quick check-in and check-out. Hotel was very clean and trendy--didn't want to come back to Michigan. I will come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean noise free”
Reviews.Author: KeshaKesh
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel when I just want peace and quiet. The hotel is near shopping and great restaurants. The rooms are very clean. The one time I had a problem with my heat someone came up in 5 minutes to fix it. I love this hotel because of the price and the tranquilty I receive.

Reviews.Title: “Too cold. Stay away in winter.”
Reviews.Author: Turner_traveler
Reviews.Content: Beds had no comforter or heavy blanket, just sheets and thin, twin size throw. This is winter in Chicago, 20 degrees outside. The heat would not work correctly in room. The sensor is located 3 inches below the only (yes I said only) out vent in room. So when the heat kicks on, the sensor thinks the room is 80 degrees (that is what I set the heat at just to 65 in room) and the heater shuts off after 1 minute, followed by 1 minute of cool fan. The bathroom has no heat or air vent at all, so freezing in there, as it did have a window. Oh, the windows are very leaky in both rooms I had, cold air just blowing in. No blackout curtains. Who doesn't have either thick curtains or blackout? The noise is either loud street noise or loud elevator. Very very very tiny room. Cheap towels. The only plus stuff, good location. Free breakfast, nice tv. The rate was good, but I will never come back, as the point of a hotel is to sleep. Between the loud noise and the cold, I did not get much.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: mcm1969
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I was really worried about the size of the room - especially since I was going to be sharing with my friend. As it turned out the room size was not a problem. Like I said, there were 2 of us; we both had 1 large suitcase and 1 other smaller piece of luggage each; we bought more things while we were there; we stayed for 10 days. If we managed anyone can (or maybe us Brits are just used to tiny hotel rooms). I would suggest though that anyone worried about the size of the room requests a corner room (which is what we had) as these seem to be a bit bigger than the others. But yes it's true, there wasn't enough room to unpack all our clothes - which didn't bother me - I just left the suitcase by the side of my bed and my friend had hers on the long seat I think. We managed anyway, and with little inconvenience. I doubt whether the rooms would be suitable to work in - there is no comfortable seating and no table for a laptop so business travellers may want to bear that in mind. Location is fantastic. Walking distance to shops and transport. Only taxi we got the entire time we were there was to and from the airport. The staff were incredibe. So friendly and helpful. They were able to advise on places to go and how to get there. The doorman was completely adorable. And the cleaning staff second to none. Breakfast was OK too. And there was plenty of it. I'd definitely return to this gem of a place if I was visiting Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: biancalee
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a large group for a New Years Eve reunion and were generally really happy with the hotel. The rooms are reasonably large, with a lovely bathroom, comfortable beds and fairly new furnishings. The location is fantastic- close to the metro, the mag. mile and all the right sights. Everything considered the hotel is great value for money- even breakfast was included (which was pretty good, although I would've preferred a bit more of a choice). The staff were generally very accommodating- there was only a minor problem in the beginning, with the only other problem being that we seemed to constantly have to get our room cards re-made and were locked out multiple times. All in all, a great place to stay! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CZGreenlee
Reviews.Content: First off the rooms were definitely small but if your only staying with one other person it's a great deal for downtown Chicago! $59/night and a few blocks from the mile was all I needed to sell me. Great breakfast very friendly people and modern design make it feel very comfortable. Bring a fan or something though at night, you can hear people on the streets or in the hallways sometimes, but I'm a light sleeper. Would definitely stay at the Hotel Cass again!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: jensnoopb
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone else's reviews. Teeny-tiny room (we pretended that it was eurpoe), ok bathroon, nice TV, amazing location, comfy bed, nice front desk staff, sketchy carpet, decent breakfast - what more do you need (except the carpet issue)? And, for a Travelzoo rate of $59/night, an AMAZING bargain. If I can get the rate again, I would not hesitate to book this hotel. Plus, it's close to other fun & trendy hotels so we went to their lounge/bar areas to get a drink. Why spend the extra money if I'm not really in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Cheap BUT SMALL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBizDude
Reviews.Content: my room was a very large closet, however, the hotel seems to recently have been remolded. very clean and sorta trendy looking. hot breakfast was good. great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: BetsyK91
Reviews.Content: This is the best place if you just need a clean quiet place to lay your head. This is NO frills, no views, no extras. BUT a great cheeeeep price to see Chicago and spend time in a great location. Great bathroom, nice towels, clean bedding, nice TV, and cute reading eyeball lights attached to the headboard. Mini fridge, and 4 pot cup of coffee, and the hair dryer is under the sink. Safe, quiet, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: danwpny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, right in the middle of the Gold Coast. Walking distance to great food, great scenary, and the "L"/subway. The rooms are a little small though - for example in the bathroom the toilet roll holder would hit the toilet lid every time I would lift or shut it which was very annoying. Also our beds were within 1-2 feet of each other. However, with that said we were for the most part just sleeping there...but still a little more room would have been nice. Also, they did not inform me that a "hold" would be put my debit card for a week or so which would have been nice to know (suppose I had no money in there or was planning on paying a few bills during that time). Anyhow, it worked out okay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff - tiny, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: gr8travel_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few 1920's style hotels and though they are charming, I really am partial to the size of the rooms in most modern hotels. The Hotel Cass has the following in it's favor: excellent staff, clean and quiet rooms, location to Michigan Ave., great pizza places nearby and free breakfast. Cons: tiny rooms with lack of storage space in closet, dresser and bathroom. We actually did ask for an upgrade and the staff tried to accommodate us but the larger room was on a smoking floor and the smell of nicotine just about knocked us over as soon as the elevator doors opened. We chose the smaller room. Again, not a bad experience, just a bit claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing wrong with it but.......................”
Reviews.Author: Chopper266
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, and i mean tiny. We had to move some furniture around, (what little furniture there was) in order to lay our suitcases on the floor. We then had to close one of the sutcases in order to open the main door. (We had two large suitcases because we were on a long trip accross the states. We were only here for two nights and so it wasn't really a problem. If we'd been here for any length of time then it would have been a bit of a bind.) There were only 3 tiny draws for you to unpack anything. (yes i know, it's only a holiday inn "express") The room was clean, with a comfy bed and a modern and funky decor. The bathroom was a good size and clean too. There was a safe in the room too. Breakfast. Polystyrene plates, plastic knives and forks and paper cups and you just help yourself to as much as you like. Not a great selection but enough to keep most happy. Some meet, some egg, and the ususal cold stuff. No problem here. 24 hour coffee and tea in the breakfast room with paper cups and lids to take away was a definate plus point. Staff were all helpfull and amenable. Half the rooms in the hotel face the side street, and opposite is a multi story car park. There is a roller shutter door for access in and out, and whenever it opens, there is an alarm to alert pedestrians that a car may exit. This was very annoying and we were on the 12th floor. IF you want a lay-in.........forget it. We would stay here again but not for more than two nights. It's got a good location and inclusive breakfast saves you from looking for somewhere to eat, although there is a Starbucks on the other side of the street. It can be summed up by the comment that our porter made when he let us into our room. "you are wondering where the other half of the room is right?"

Reviews.Title: “great price, close to mag mile”
Reviews.Author: am1belle
Reviews.Content: We traveled there with our 3 teenage sons, using 2 rooms. Hotel was very clean. Rooms were small like everyone says, but they made good use of space. Corner rooms seemed to be bigger (we stayed in 1610 (small) & 1609 (a bit bigger). All staff were extremely friendly. Valet parking with in?out privileges is $40. Free breakfast was a good way to start the day. The fireplace in the lobby is a good place to sit & read a paper or a book. It was a quick 2 block to the magnificent mile, located on Wabash between Erie & Ontario. We got a great deal on the room through a Travelzoo.com link to the site. It's a good launching point if your Chicago Trip is going to be active and you are looking for good, clean & value. Free WIFI. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, amazing employees, nice stay !!”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is AMAZING !!!!!!! Really you can not be in a more perfect spot in downtown Chicago. A block off the Magnificent Mile and a few blocks down from Giordano's Pizza what more do you need !! The rooms are very European, comfortable with a nice bed, linens, TV and bathroom. Nothing super large or super luxurious, just very practical !!! The staff was AMAZING !!..Shaun and Fran at the front desk , well, you could not design better employees if you tried, just out of this world customer services !! So nice in today's society where customer services seems to be so lacking !!! I highly recommend this hotel especially if you are here for a quick weekend getaway !!

Reviews.Title: “Guy Trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Gilmour9393
Reviews.Content: Every October a group of friends and I travel to different cities in the US. This year we picked Chicago. We ended up staying at the Hotel Cass on a recommendation from a friend in Chicago. It's in a great spot. Central to just about everything you'd want to do in Chicago. While other reviewers have complained about the smallness of the rooms, we barely spent anytime in them. Yes...they are small. The beds are comfortable. The room was clean. The bathroom was nice and also clean. We didn't eat the comp breakfast. The staff was nice, especially the doormen. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with directions and anything that was needed. The Hotel Cass is a remodel from an old hotel. It's not your typical Holiday Inn Express you see off the interstate. I loved the lobby and the decor. Not a bad choice if you need to be in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “We love Holiday Inn Express' - But not this one!”
Reviews.Author: Windsor_OntarioMaple
Reviews.Content: Our family stays at Holiday Inns and Express' all the time. We thought we would continue the pattern and stay there to celebrate our 11th anniversary. Wrong move. We don't mind small rooms with a great location. That's what it had going for it. But what disturbed us was the lack of cleanliness and care for the room itself. The drain in the sink was broken and the bed linens looked dirty and used. YUK. Just not something that says "Welcome, leave your worries to us." The positive: Great hotel location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE- Rooms are tiny, service is bad, not kid-friendly, and cable constantly loses signal”
Reviews.Author: heatherh2603
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and I will never go back. The rooms are tiny and there is very little room is provided to unpack your clothes and place your luggage. Amenities are scarce and it took housekeeping 5 hours to bring extra towels. During my first visit, I received a room with a king bed, yet the tv was placed on the side wall, so it was nearly impossible to relax in bed and watch tv without having to contort my body sideways. During my next visit, I received a room with a queen bed. The room was so small that when we opened the door, the valet could not even get our luggage inside and he suggested we call the front desk to request a larger room. We did and, in fairness, they did move us to a slightly larger room witha queen bed. I was also upset that they charged me the same price for the queen bed as they did for the king bed during my first visit. I opted for the the valet parking service with the understanding that we needed to phone the front desk 15 minutes ahead of time in order to have it brought out. I called for the car on two different occasion, and one tim eit ook 35 minutes, and the next time it took 45 minutes, thus making me late for my appointments. They do serve a continental breakfast, however the lady that maintains it starts closing it down 15 minutes before she is supposed to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, smallest hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Rdtrips
Reviews.Content: We went here for a long weekend and it was a great location just off the Magnificent Mile, walking distance to a lot of attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was the smallest hotel room I had ever stayed in anywhere. Small would have been okay if there was somewhere to put my suitcase! It was however, a very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lkastens
Reviews.Content: My church youth choir stayed at this hotel during our trip to Chicago. I can't say enough about the helpful, pleasant staff. They were amazing! They handed me our keys when we arrived; no filling out paperwork, no hassle of any type. By the time the kids were off the bus, I had keys in hand and was able to hand them out with minimal confusion. They assisted with filling the coolers with ice in the morning. Past hotels we've used have discouraged us even using the ice machines for this purpose. In a city where a hotel breakfast costs a minimum of $10, the free breakfast each morning was most welcome and consisted of eggs and other protein, fruit, cereals, juice & milk. The kids had a good start each morning. The only drawback to this hotel is that the guest rooms ARE small. But they were comfortable, and as we were only there to sleep so it wasn't that much of an issue with us. And we couldn't beat the location or the price. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a small space with great service”
Reviews.Author: seross
Reviews.Content: Obviously an old Chitown hotel converted into a chic modern space with excellent lighting, windows that open to the breeze, self-regulating AC and heat, a huge King bed with great bedding and pillows, two table lamps, a granite countertop and chair for work space, a built-in upholstered banquette against the wall near the bed, special focused reading lamps on each side of bed that were tiny LEDS on a gooseneck that I loved and a very nice bathroom. Totally quiet, had a great night's sleep after a 15 hour flight. The comp breakfast was the usual junk but many people seemed to scarf down a dozen pieces of bacon and wads of scrambled eggs with their nutrtionless sweet rolls and breads. But I am super picky about food, so if you eat this kind of stuff regularly, you will be quite happy. Great help from the staff to solve a few thorny problems like how was I going to get two 70 pound suitcases into the Amtrak station at Union Station. They made the calls and assured me of how it could work and did a number of other searches for me that made the most of my short time in Chicago. i stayed here on points but would definitely pay to stay there again and recommend to others. Two blocks off MIchigan and in a great restaurant and hotel neighborhood in River North area. I suspect you can get great pricing deals here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: KatieB46
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location and the hot breakfast. It did not disappoint us.The breakfast had eggs, sausage or bacon with all the usual carbs! It was great not having to search for places to eat in the morning when we had such a short time to explore Chicago. We had a King bed on our reservation but there weren't any available but got a Queen. It was a good thing as the room was extremely small but very compact. It was fine for our 2 night stay but anything else would have been a challenge. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful with whatever we needed. Later in the month we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express O'Hare and had the same good experience with the breakfast and the staff. The room was bigger due to the size and age of the hotel. We will use the Holiday Inn Express again on our next adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk couldn't be bothered.....”
Reviews.Author: PamelaJones123
Reviews.Content: I had a simple question on the room size when researching this hotel as it kept popping up on various websites under "suite hotels" After looking extensively at all the web material, my question was still not answered so I called the front desk. The women was rude and could not be bothered to answer a simple question, despite it being midnight in Chicago so not a very busy time. She kept putting me through central reservations/automated phone service, although I told her that I already had that info online! IF the person at the front desk is this unaccomodating, I can only imagine the poor service. I stay in Chicago frequently, about 4-5 times a year, so thought I would check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: benmacd
Reviews.Content: We looked for something downtown for our visit to Chicago, and the location of this Holiday Inn Express was perfect. The room was pretty small, but had recently been renovated and looked good, was well organized and had all the standard ametities. The staff at reception were friendly, and the breakfast was basic but perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - skip the "free breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: KSTravlr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend in Chicago. Stayed at HIE - great central location close to everything and the L. Room was small but quaint and comfortable. We weren't bothered by the size. The noise in the hotel is very noticeable though late at night - could hear everything in the halls and your neighbors. Free continental breakfast was the worst we ever had at a hotel. Very limited selection and all coffee/creamers were empty. No fruit of any kind. Not very well managed or stocked. Go around the corner to Eggsperience for a yummy breakfast! Bellman were great with directions & recommendations. Overall enjoyable stay and loved the easy access to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and front staff, small but comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jaywtea
Reviews.Content: Decent enough conversion of an older hotel to HIE. My room was tiny but suited my needs just fine. The only other thing I could have used would have been a refrigerator since I was there for a week. My only other complaint would be that early in the week the breakfast was ready and set out by the 6:30AM starting time but later in the week I got the impression that the crew (different people I think) thought 6:30AM was the time they were to start putting food out. It was more like 6:45-50 by the time everything was ready. Since I was trying to get up and out as early as possible I really noticed the difference. Otherwise, the desk staff and the bell people were all very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Decent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanya4
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel Cass/Holiday Inn Express. We stayed for the weekend over the air and water show weekend and just as the first visit - it was pleasant. We traveled with our 5 yr old daughter and needless to say, she just loved going downstairs for breakfast. Breakfast is your typical fare, but there is plenty to chose from and the staff was quite helpful. However, do ge there early as it does get busy and the dining area is very small. Speaking of small....the rooms are not suites and are pretty small. Decent hairdryer and toiletries. However in a city like Chicago, why do you need a big room? Great location, very close to many attractions and in between two red line stops. Overall another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jabri
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location. Located between Michigan Ave.(Mag Mile) and State St. ............it is right in the middle of everything. Staff was very obliging and always ready to answer your questions and try and help out any way they can. Yes the rooms are very very small. We were 4 of us but we managed. We would lie on one side of the bed and look outside the window and see the John Hancock Tower.......what better view than that??? We would definitely come back just because of the location. I am Priority Club member and got my 2 nights stay free with my points. Everything was within walking distance and enjoyed our stay thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikegolf123
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, and good breakfast. Would highly recommend. Rooms are small, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mmrrmmrr
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our recent stay at the Cass Hotel. The best part is the location. The staff were friendly and helpful...especially our doorman. They have a very nice selection at their breakfast. The worst part is the room was TINY. we, literally, could not open our door all the way b/c it hit the bed. there is a tiny closet with a file cabinet in it (dresser?) there were 2 of us in the room and it was tight. had to keep our clothes in our suitcases b/c there was no where to put them. Bathroom was adequate. but it could use some decent shelves and hooks. Would I stay there again?
