I got the room at a discount and if i found a larger room for the same price I would not...but who stays in their room the whole time? also, the tv did not work well.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel just off Michigan Ave. Rooms are small but staff was superb!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife3-4
Reviews.Content: At first, our group was rather put off by the size of the rooms. They are VERY small as are the bathrooms. Once we got settled in though, we realized the location of the hotel couldn't be beat, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel Cass is located two blocks off Michigan Avenue which meant we were within walking distance of most attractions or a short cab/bus ride if it was a bit farther out. We were also two blocks down from the Red Line train. It was nice being a few blocks off Michigan Avenue as the street was slightly quieter. We also found the staff to be wonderfully helpful. The bellhops/doormen were always willing to help with directions, dinner recommendation, or hailing a cab. Although the room size wasn't ideal, the other positive factors made our stay here more than worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Results”
Reviews.Author: Kirin11
Reviews.Content: This is not your standard Holiday Inn Express. The good They allowed me to check in early and I was able to hang up my business suit wide range of complimentry newspaper The web sight promises a fitness center which they don't have supposildy they ha an arrangement with a health club which ended. They offer the Interconitel for $18.00 a day. Also breakfast is not till 6:30 on weekdays

Reviews.Title: “Size doesn't matter when you are in a place as beautiful as Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: MsCanada
Reviews.Content: The room is small, but equipped with the most comfortable bed I've slept on in a hotel. The staff are friendly and courteous. The breakfast is great and free. The location is A+. The bathroom is small but very clean...and the shower is fabulous! The view is horrible...but who wants to be in their room except to sleep anyway. It's a short walk to the Willis Tower where an amazing view of Chicago can be found. Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Would I stay here again?....absolutely. For anything it might be lacking, it makes up for in value.

Reviews.Title: “VERY SMALL rooms”
Reviews.Author: RisingSun96815
Reviews.Content: I walked into this VERY SMALL room and knew right away that I wanted to leave. I immediately called the front desk and demanded to check out early with refund. They told me to call the web site I booked through and talk to them; so I did. They told me the hotel would not allow me to check out early with refund. The hotel did move me to a slightly larger room, but not much better. So I had to stay in this very small room for 2 nights, which I paid a lot of money for. Worst value in a hotel ever in my life, and I've stayed in many hotels over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, noisy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: The Sherriff and his lady have sampled quite a few Holiday Express hotels in the last year. They seem to fall into two types - relatively new and rather soulless out-of-town properties with ample space, parking, etc. and rehabbed older properties in city centres. This is one of the latter - and not the best of its kind. When giving the old Hotel Cass a makeover, it seems there was no real attempt to rethink the internal layout or accommodations so that a veneer of modernization has been slapped on a rather tired property. Our room was very cramped with virtually no wardrobe or storage space, which meant we were falling over our own suitcases all the time and the bed was pushed right up to a wall with not much in the way of lighting. Chicago was pretty hot but the air-conditioner was so noisy that we couldn't run it - although the windows did open and we were able to get enough ventilation without street noise. This is a quiet property in that sense but the sound insulation between rooms and corridors was poor and other guests caused a fair bit of disturbance just coming and going. The decor verged on the shabby, although relatively new. On the positive side, we enjoyed one of the best complimentary breakfasts we have had with this chain, the staff were bouncing with enthusiasm to help us make the best of our stay - and a little disappointed that we were such old Chicago hands that we didn't need much help - and the location is brilliant, just a couple of blocks off Michigan Avenue and very close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter76
Reviews.Content: I give the hotel a five star for location. You can't ask for a better location. Everything is close by. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is ok. The only negative aspect of the hotel is they only changed my sheet once even though I wanted my sheets changed daily. They also don't give you wash clothes for your face. I only got them twice during my stay. Downtown Chicago is beautiful. It is very clean and it exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Damn small room, great staff, clean, fast internet..........”
Reviews.Author: rrdude
Reviews.Content: I honestly thought I was on the old show "Candid Camera", or the modern equivalent, "Punked" when I opened the room door on the 15 (out of 16) floors. I have NEVER seen a room so small. Agree with other posters that the "desk" is not really a desk at all, and the "dresser"? Try a file cabinet in the minuscule closet, (sans hangers) was another jaw-dropper. But I rated it "above average" why? Staff, cleanliness, and amenities. OK, they didn't deliver the paper under the door one of two days, big deal. The location is GREAT, and if you are NOT traveling with family, (i.e., solo) and you are NOT a big person, and you DON'T plan on spending any period of time in the room, then you will be happy with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: JerryPPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I'm just going to reinterate what most of the reviewers are saying. Darn, the room was small. Practically no storage space (deadly for those coming to shop on the very close "Mag Mile"). The chair provided for use with the desk "area" (can't call it a desk, it's really just a 14" wide shelf on the wall) is very low, so working on the computer is tough. And for my final complaint, can't somebody tell the Chicago PD that they don't HAVE to run their sirens at 4:00AM??? Other than those things, the hotel staff is excellent, Cleanliness is acceptable, The location is perfect. The complementary breakfast is good (but really, somebody should tell Holiday Inn that salsa has surpassed kechup as the most popular condiment in the USA. I stay at alot of Holday Inns and none of them have it). That pretty much raps it up.

Reviews.Title: “Just be aware if you're a big person....”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: First, we got to our room (booked through HW) and saw one queen-sized bed. Well, partner & I are big guys so we went back to front desk to ask about changing rooms. Unfortunately, because of the Icelandic volcano the hotel was completely full due to guests who were unable to leave Chicago extending their stay. But the hotel was able to provide a rollaway (the best they could do, but certainly not optimum considering the rooms are already small). The other unfortunate circumstance was that we were in the handicap room which meant a larger bathroom (with many grab-bars) but a closet with everything down at wheelchair height (with the coat rack covering up the tiny dresser because it needed to be within reaching distance...another inconvenience for two guys that are each 6'5") For a week stay it was pretty difficult to deal with our stuff as anything hung on the coat rack covered the dresser and there were no other portable luggage racks to set a suitcase on (we both tend to live out of our suitcases). I would imagine the setup of the handicap rooms are different than than a regular room but if you unintentionally end up in a handicap room, you should consider changing rooms. We were there for a week and experienced pretty much what everyone else reported. Fantastic location, good breakfast, free wi-fi, friendly (almost obsequious) staff, noisy hallways, crowded elevators. I would be happy to stay here again by myself (as the HW price was really good) but not with another person.

Reviews.Title: “It was an okay stay”
Reviews.Author: deanieweanie
Reviews.Content: My family lives in the Chicago area, me and my sister stay downtown every year for Lollapalooza. The hotel is in a great location for its price, the front desk was very nice and we had free breakfast. Yes, the walls were thin, the front desk staff was overwhelmed answering phones and trying to check you in, the elevators took forever!! But for a place that your just putting your head down, its fine. It is a few blocks from the train and all the restaurants are there. I'm staying there again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Diebushka
Reviews.Content: The hotel room and bathroom are clean, small, but enough for what we needed: we only wanted to sleep and wash, so for that purpose is ok. Beds are comfortable, breakfast is good: cereal, yogurt, coffee, juices, eggs, bacon, different types of bread, fruit... Location is great, you can walk to several tourist places in Chicago and the train station and bus stops are just a block away, so is very convenient. What we didnÂ´t like is we stayed in the second floor and next to us were VERY noisy people for our 2 day stay. I was with my kids and the neighbors were single men, so ask not to check with these kind of travelers, because you wonÂ´t sleep, we could hear all the conversation of these people. They were opening and closing doors all night. I guess because the corridors are VERY narrow...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and convenient with GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property three times in the past twelve months. Each time I am greeted warmly and promptly checked in. The staff are extremely friendly, and the doormen are so sweet. I never touched a door the entire time I was there- or the elevator button if they were standing near. Also, very appreciative of the tips they received! The hotel is in a fantastic location for business or pleasure. There are many good restaurants in the area, and grocery stores if you want to stock up your in room refrigerator. The hotel is small- period. It's an old building! Because the rooms are small try to get one of the corner rooms (the three I've been in have all ended in "8". Also, the higher floors are better. I was in room 508 this time and I had a lovely view of 4 brick walls! One nice thing is that the windows open for fresh air. Bathrooms also small, but my room had a small table on wheels so I rolled it in and it gave me the extra room I needed for my toiletries. I wouldn't say this is the best hotel for business, even though that's why I was there. But, I didn't have to work very much in the room. There was a small desk, free wireless and a decent light, but the chair is not conducive for sitting in for long periods working on a laptop. The free breakfast is very nice, good selection and a few hot items. There is a pleasant breakfast room with both table and lounge type seating. You will see families, student groups, business travelers and couples of all ages. I don't know when the hotel was remodeled, but I will say that it is beginning to show normal wear and tear and felt more "tired" this time than it had previously. Nothing bothersome, but they will need to refresh carpets, towels and bedding before too long.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: stefchatman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Cass/Holiday Inn Express and must say that it was one of my best stays ever. Especially considering that I was dreading going to Chicago because of the outrageous prices. I got lucky, ok an unbelieveable deal on an internet site to stay the weekend in Chicago, so I had to take it, because it cost less than the cost of doing my one day training just flying in and out the same day. The hotel is so centrally located that within 3 blocks you havae everything that you could ever think about. I'm not a shopper but I did walk on Michigan Ave which is around the corner. The rooms are small, but very tastefully designed especially if you like art deco like I do. The 42 in wall mounted flat screen and the free wireless had me laughing at the folks paying to connect at the starbucks across the street. The free breakfast was also a serious plus, but in chicago it was a Godsend. I can't believe the inflated rates of everything included food there. Luckily there are hundreds of places to eat everywhere. The best thing about the hotel is the STAFF! The desk staff have to be the best I've ever stayed with. Saved me hundreds of dollars with the advice, and remembered my name each and everytime i came and went.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: dubrovnik123
Reviews.Content: If you want a great centrally located hotel in Chicago, where you are treated with some of the best customer service, for a reasonable rate, this is the place. The location is wonderful. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. The room is a bit on the small size but we didn't spend much time there. The breakfast was plenitul and very good. The smaller hotels are the best for treating you like a real person and they appreciate your business. We will definitly stay here on our next trips to Chicago. Thank you Hotel Cass for a good trip!!

Reviews.Title: “My second stay, I'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Duccy
Reviews.Content: I happened upon Hotel Cass last year when I was planning a trip to Chicago to hear some music so I decided to stay again this trip. I couldn't be happier, very nice rooms, good breakfast bar, coffee available 24 hours, excellent location. Hotel Cass will be at the top of my list of places to stay whenever I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stop!!”
Reviews.Author: JMOOREEllsinore
Reviews.Content: drove in from Missouri for a half marathon arrived at hotel around 4:30 pm. The only real negative I have about this hotel is there is no place to park out side while you check in and get your bag's. We had to park in a garage on the same block then get our stuff and take it in to check in. Check in was quick, rooms are typical chicago style hotel rooms SMALL but I am use to that. Service was great, breakfast was nice. Hotel is located perfectly to mich. ave. and all sorts of resturants and shops. I would stay here agian if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Rated three stars for a reason”
Reviews.Author: tgsauder
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at the Cass. This hotel is in a nice location. They have a very nice lobby and a great free breakfast. The room is okay. The bathroom is very, very small. There was a closet with a safe and three drawers so you wouldn't be able to fit anything longer than a shirt in it. There were not enough plug ins on the wall to accommodate the cute little lamps they have on the sides of the beds for reading and the lamp and clock so at least a couple of things are not in service. I had to crawl under the bed and unplug one thing to plug in another. No kleenex and the room service attendant knocked on our door at around 9am even though we had a PRIVACY PLEASE sign on our room. Not cool! Also, they put us in a room which backed to the elevator so if you get one of those, asked to be moved. We got this room for $59+ on Hotwire which was great for four people and the free breakfast so even though I thought the hotel was just okay, I'd still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and complimentary extras make this hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: zthetravelbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for four nights in December. PRICE: We actually booked through HotWire, so we didn't know which hotel we were getting until after we paid. It was only USD$59/night though, which is amazing value when you consider its location and star-rating (3 1/2). We checked the hotel website after booking and saw that rooms were going from $300 - so if you can get a deal like we did, it is excellent value. LOCATION: We took the airport shuttle which was expensive ($20 each, one-way) and took us more than an hour to reach the hotel (we had to drop other people off along the way). But the hotel is located just off Magnificent Mile, on Wabash Avenue. There are plenty of shops (and nice ones, too!) and eating places. It is easy to get to public transport and you could probably walk to a lot of places. ROOM: The room was TINY. Probably one of - if not the - smallest hotel rooms I have stayed in. The bed was nice and large, which took up most of the room and meant only one person at a time could walk past it. There was a narrow cupboard and a window seat (which we just chucked our bags on top of) and the bathroom again was tiny. However the room size did not matter so much to us, as we were there to sight-see and visit friends. Also, for what it lacked in size, it made up for in cleanliness. It was spotless, and the bathroom was sparkling. There was also a brand new LCD flat-screen television with free cable. The decor was contemporary and trendy (including the very interesting wallpaper in the bathroom!) AMENITIES: This hotel had a lot of extras that made our stay more pleasant. They provide a small coffee machine and free tea and coffee bags in rooms, which meant if we woke up late and missed breakfast we at least could make a coffee. There was a free hot and continental buffet breakfast every day downstairs, which meant we could fill up on that and not have to spend too much on lunch. There was complimentary high-speed wireless (we have a laptop) that we accessed from our room - and when we needed to print something we were able to use the free computers downstairs (and we didn't pay to print either). They have a fitness center, but we didn't use it. Room service is provided by a local restaurant between certain hours. We ordered in the first night and they delivered to our room door (just keep in mind that after 11pm you would have to go downstairs to collect the food as they won't let people up). SERVICE: The staff were always friendly and personable - from the doormen to the manager on desk. Every time we entered the hotel we were greeted cheerfully by the staff, which may seem like a small thing but it was really appreciated. The doorman also called a taxi for us on the day we left for the airport and negotiated a flat rate ($40) which would have been exactly what we paid for the shared shuttle - so make sure you ask if they can do that for you! One night our remote for the TV wasn't working; we called downstairs and they sent someone up within minutes with a new remote. The cleaning staff always did a nice job and the rooms were turned down daily and bathroom cleaned thoroughly as well. We travel on a budget, so if we could get this hotel again at such a great deal I would definitely stay here. One feels very safe here; after a certain time you need your key to enter the building and the elevator up to the rooms. Although the rooms are small (which doesn't matter if you are only sleeping there), the staff and the extras they throw in make the stay at Hotel Cass - Holiday Inn Express a wonderful place to stay. We really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter38
Reviews.Content: I dont usually use tripadvisor to write reviews but felt i needed to recommend this hotel!. It is in an excellent location, a very short distance from mag mile, bearing in mind i stayed there when it was -8 degrees, short distances were very important. The rooms are big enough for a weekend break, they had a huge bed- i stayed in king size with tons of pillows and very warm. Air conditioning and heating was very good. The room was very clean with free wi-fi which was a definate plus!. had a big enough wardrobe with a safe inside - very handy. Bathroom was very nice, not the biggest but had enough space. The hotel offers free breakfast which was very nice, it also offers a very well organised luggage storage room before check in and after check out. The lounge is very pleasant and a nice area to relax after the stress of travelling. the staff are very helpful and cant do enough to help. As with any american hotel the cleaning staff are very prompt so if you like a lie in, i recommend the do not disturb sign!. This is an EXCELLENT hotel, i would recommend to anyone, certainly at a bargain price for the facilities it offers. ps. It is well worth visiting Giardanos the italians down the street, AMAZING food!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading...disappointing, would not stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mtkkk
Reviews.Content: Needed three rooms with two beds each, none available, also no rollaways available. We had to reserve three rooms with one bed each and were told we could use air mattresses. When we arrived in the room, we understood why no rollaways were available, there is no room for them! In all my traveling I have never seen a room so small. Disappointed in front desk staff, as we all stood in the lobby, they knew there was no way two adults and two teenagers would fit in each room. Also should legally not be allowed. It was extremely noisy all night long, dirty and old feeling. Gives the franchise a bad reputation. Shocked at the other reviews, it is not a nice property, there are much better options for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality - Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Shawnaree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trade show Oct 4th and 5th - originally planning to spend just one night. The staff was extremely accomodating - the door man was exceptionally pleasant & the place was clean and well maintained. The building itself is old, the rooms are nothing fancy, but the service was great and there was a full breakfast buffet included in the price. A great location & a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel-above average location”
Reviews.Author: royal421
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough, nothing special. Rooms were very small but we knew they would be going in. The location was the selling point. Very close to John Hancock, shopping mall, and bus lines. The breakfast was pretty good, alot to offer. If you can get a good price (we paid $79.00) it is a good place to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for site seeing in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: seasoned_traveler81
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on hotwire for this hotel. The location is perfect for site seeing. The magnificent mile is a few blocks away, as well as the Sears (or Wilson's) Tower. The staff is very pleasant and always greeting and saying "welcome" when you come into the hotel. The room size is very small though, or as the staff put it, "cozy" but that can be expected for a downtown hotel. The rooms are clean. The breakfast is good, with eggs, cereal, cinnamon buns, etc. Overall a good deal for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, incredible chicago bargain, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: theavailablemom
Reviews.Content: At the last moment, I decided to visit our daughter in Chicago. She lives in Wicker Park and has a neatness challenge, Last minute guests are not her strong suit. So I went on a web site and found this hotel for an incredible rate of $59. This included a hot breakfast. The hotel is in an excellent location and is walking distance from museums and shopping, the el and buses. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean, bed was comfortable. The only problem was the size. I was traveling for two days. The chest of drawers consisted of a file cabinet inside the closet which held only five hangers. At checkout, the staff told me that if my spouse came they could put in a rack for additional clothes. This would not have been possible. For the solo traveler this was a great deal. It is across the street from a Trader Joe's. Hot shower was great. I would stay again but not at a traditional Chicago rate. There were many families there and seemed to be doing well. It is not a room for anyone with a cane or walker but all in all, a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Logmac
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to Chicago for a mother/daughter extended weekend (3 nights/4 days). We loved the location, many nearby shopping areas, restaurants, etc. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a huge savings, we were able to eliminate lunch and just have an early supper. I would definately recommend it to others. The room was clean but small; the size was not a factor as we only used the room to sleep in. Kelly & Edwin were the staff that stick out in my mind...thanks for a super stay in Chicago :)

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic first time visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: scotnsyl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cass was the perfect place to stay for our first visit to Chicago. We drove into the city and found the hotel fairly easily. However, we had to go around the block since we passed it at first. Valet parking had been advertised when our reservations had been made. The doorman was very apologetic that it was unavailable, but gave us the location of a carpark charging only $29.00 per day with in and out privilages. Not a bad deal and the lot was only one block up the next street. As it turned out, we never needed the car anyway. The hotel has a fantastic location within walking distance of most all the key sights. There are also many shops and restaurants you can reach on foot, even in moderately high heels. The staff was amazing, always greeting you and asking how they could assist. Princess at the front desk and Edwin the doorman stood out especially. Our room(1203) was very small, but was comfortable and well appointed. Daily breakfast being included was a great cost savings and was more than adequate. All in all, we would consider staying here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravlrDundas
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire and was provided the Hotel Cass for an amazing rate. Staff was amazing and I have to praise "Princess" who offered loads of guides, local knowledge and shopping maps for my shopaholic girlfriend. Room check-in was painless and speedy, felt very warm and invited. Given room 1408 which is a city view and looking at the layout one of the largest. The room amenities were ample, yet small as others have noted. Only two small complaints: one is the lack of drawer space, with a small drawer offered in the closet, the other is the lack of space in the bathroom. The included breakfast is amazing and was a welcome start to the day. Cleaning service is top notch, the room was cleaned in the time it took for us to eat breakfast and return; very pleasant surprise! Location is a big draw for the Hotel Cass, everything is walking distance away. If you use the CTA take the Chicago stop instead of Grant on the red line due to construction. Very happy guest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value, Neat and Clean”
Reviews.Author: fourseastravelco
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a short week-end trip. We found it to be an excellent value for the price. The location is convenient to walking just about anywhere in the city, and is close to all transportation. The room was tiny, but quaint, and they made good use of every available space. We enjoyed the flat screen tv, and free internet. The free breakfast was an added plus, more variety than many other hotels. We didn't bring a car, but the nearby parking was very expensive. It is located near some very nice restaurants and bars. We especially liked the 1492 Tapas Bar. The staff was very helpful in giving directions, holding our luggage, and overall they were extremely accomodating. Two suggestions: update the carpeting in the hallways, and wash the windows and screens. I have already made a reservation to stay here again next month on my next trip to Chicago. I felt very comfortable and was happy with the value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cass during a professional conference. I've read the reviews, and expected a small room. It turned out to be not as small as I expected. In fact, there was plenty of room for me. I've stayed in some much smaller rooms in the past (one in Boston, one in L.A.). I do think having two people in this room might have been a problem. From the hotel diagram on the back of my door, it appeared there were some bigger rooms available, so it would be important to ask about this if it bothers you. When I got to my room the carpet was wet in one spot (possibly a roof leak?), and the staff could not have been more accommodating in getting me into another room ASAP. The staff were all excellently helpful and friendly during my stay. I liked the second room even better than the first. It was not noisy at all, and I loved the large flat-screen TV on the wall. The bed was extremely comfortable. The free breakfast in the morning was appreciated, since I was always on my way to early meetings. Sure, these sorts of breakfast buffets don't have quite the high quality of fresh-cooked food served to one's table. But it also wasn't bad food. I also appreciated the free computer access in the breakfast nook, since I was not traveling with a computer. I stayed four nights, and could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel but barely.”
Reviews.Author: TampaFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: Our experience with Hotel Cass was a mixed bag. The staff is either friendly or overly rude depending on who you speak with. The rooms are actually REALLY TINY and when traveling in two's for more than three days, it will take some getting used to as there is hardly room to walk around the bed much less find room for clothing and suitecases. That being said, it was very clean, comfortable, and noise free. When the hotel gets busy, the two elevators available (one of which is a service elevator and hardly ever comes around) is SUPER slow...like "wait at least 5 minutes for it to come up and then stop on every floor on the way down" slow. The breakfast is AWESOME with omelets, scrambled eggs, cinamon rolls, juice, milk, cereal, bagels, breads, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, fruit, etc...but get there early to take advantage! The kitchen staff don't know the meaning of the word hospitality! On multiple occassions, they stopped refilling food twenty minutes prior to close even if there are guests waiting for their breakfast. Not only that, but when they close, they will take food out from under you. When asking for items if close to closing, expect the staff to be rude and unaccomodating. The location though is AWESOME! It's central to everything! If you don't want to take a cab from the hotel, take it L, it runs straight from within the airport to two blocks from the front door of Hotel Cass. Take the Blue line to Jackson and then transfer to the Red Line to Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: adomo
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire and I thought I had listed proper number of guests, but on my confirmation I noticed I did not have enough beds. Hotel staff was soooo helpful and accommodating. They run out of cots quickly so we got lucky. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Yes they were quaint but I would go back. It is located in a good location for fun. Go to the Italian Deli just down the street to pack a picnic. Jump on the Michigan Ave #151 south and head to Buckingham fountain to eat by the lake

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff, good breakfast, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: Easy to get around Chicago from here, close to the L, lots of restaurants/Bars. Can walk to Michigan Ave/Navy Pier/etc. L to ballparks. Staff very helpful, TV in room limited (some channels not available/could never access pay channels). Room is small but okay considering you are out in Chicago most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: TimmyDevon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are planning on using it as a base. The rooms are small but fully equipped, and we were on the 16th floor so we had a nice view. The room had free wireless and a flat screen TV. The breakfast wasn't anything special but was included. The hotel is in a great location, its very easy to get to the loop and "Big John", and is very near to Pizzeria Uno! The neighbourhood seemed safe, the hotel is on a quiet (ish) street but near to lots of shops and restaurants. Would recommend to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Maximum use of premium property”
Reviews.Author: Stevens08
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and accommodating in spite of its small size. Every inch of the room, as well as other areas of the hotel, was maximized. The interior design was pleasing. I would stay here again, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChcgoGirl
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel has small rooms. But they are clean and nicely appointed. I can see if you're planning to stay more than a couple nights it might get claustrophobic and you may need more room to unpack, but if it's only one or two nights, I thought it was great. The room IS small, that's for sure, and the view we had left much to be desired, but we came downtown for a concert, not to sit in our room all night and stare out the window. The location was great, close to great shopping and several restaurants and within walking distance to The House of Blues, which is where our concert was. The room was very clean and the staff was quite pleasant. The only downside I can find is there is no parking lot specifically for the hotel, but that is not unusual for Chicago. There is a parking garage adjacent to the hotel which is pretty expensive. $34/night with no in or out privileges, or you can valet it for $45/night with in and out privileges. Everything was within walking distance for our purpose though so we just parked ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Small”
Reviews.Author: I82X73
Reviews.Content: This is now a Holiday Inn Express - operated hotel. General: The hotel occupies a small footprint of real estate. There are 16 floors indicated on the elevator. Everything is small, so keep that in mind. The elevators are on the small side and slow during the morning breakfast time. Everything is very clean and well maintained. Location: Two (short) blocks off the Magnificent Mile. Close to a number of attractions and easy walking distance to a number of eateries. Rooms: The rooms, as indicated elsewhere, are SMALL. That did not bother me as I was only sleeping there. However, if youare wanting to lounge around your room during the day, this is not the place for you. My room on the 4th floor was a king locaed on the interior of the building. The window faced out to a central core (nothing to see, but daylight did come through). The bed occupied most of the room and was very comfortable. There was a desk at the foot of the bed. A flat panel TV was mounted at the side of the bed, best viewed from a small sitting bench. The bathroom was small, but comfortable. A very nice tub / shower was easy to access. A hairdryer was kept under the sink. The sink was a nice deep model with great water flow. As noted throughout the hotel, the room clearly had recently been remodeled. The room included a coffe maker, iron and ironing board, small closet and safe. Wireless high-speed internet was provided (free). Furnishings and decor: The decor and furnishings were bizarre. While the overall appearence is clean and well maintained, the furnishings are straight out of the 60's and the "house of tomorrow" look. Trust me, the furniture was ugly and uncomfortable in the 60's and it still is now. The bench in the room that sufices for a sofa was more uncomfortable than a pew in a Quaker church. The "table" in the room was a moveable flat top mushroom that might hold one plate. The hotel would be well advised to change decor soon. Staff: Helpful and courteous. The doormen were great. The desk staff were all efficient though not neccesarily warm. Value: The room rates went up $80 a night during my stay, so I am not sure the costs are any better than some other nearby well-known properties. You would have to investigate that more when booking. Overall: Clean, comfortable and quiet. Good breakfast. Small rooms that meet your basic needs -- not for lounging however. Elevators (two) are smallish. They are operated by your room key card. Expect a long wait during the breakfast time. Breakfast: The free breakfast is very nice with a good selection. On busy days, you may have trouble finding a place to sit. A large portion of the common area is occupied by flat sofas without tables (seems like a waste of space to me). The staff kept everything stocked and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate size room - bizarre furnishings”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some previous reviews, I found my room to be small but adequate in size. The furnishings, however, were another story. A large marble table was at the end of the bed with barely enough room to get in and out of the chair. Two low chairs that looked like they belong in the children's furniture section at IKEA were also in the room as was a bench that was totally incongruous. In fact the furniture was probably the ugliest I have ever encountered in a hotel room. On a more positive note, the staff was superb, the lobby attractive and the breakfast area especially nice. The hotel's wi-fi had the best signal I have ever found in a hotel. The in-room safe was another good feature. So for a well located River North hotel and a reasonable rate, Hotel Cass is recommended, as long as you don't mind the bizarre furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and modern, but cramped”
Reviews.Author: PhillyPhanJS
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice for those who don't like standard hotel decor and don't mind not having much room. The recently renovated rooms are furnished with modern, comfortable furniture & fixtures. However, the left little spare room. My king bed took up most of the sleeping area -- the desk was against the wall at the foot of the bed, and there was just enough room to get the chair out to sit down. On the closet side, there was just enough room to open the door, which was about 2/3 the size of a normal closet (it was narrower than my full-sized garment bag). The only drawers in the room were a small set of 3 in the closet, about the size of a set that fits under a desk, leving little room for long hanging objects. The elevator was fast for me, but you needed to use your door key card. it sometimes didn't read on the first try, but one it did, the trip was fast. Elevator music included Bjork and the Smiths, to give you an idea of the type of customers they're targeting, or at least the tastes of the staff. A few minor nits: the breakfast was the standard HIE, but the first morning there was no yogurt and the two days they had omelets, many were overdone almost to the point of being burnt. My TV (HC LCD) had trouble with a few channels, one of them ESPN. And the square, flat sink basin ran a little slow (not sure if it was partially clogged or because of the design.) However, if you're only going to be sleeping in your room, it's a pretty good deal. A very convenient location with a variety of stores & restaurants nearby, and a subway stop a few blocks away. If you're staying for a while, there's a Trader Joe's across the street and a Whole Foods a few blocks away. There's just not much room to keep stuff in the room and no fridge.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff, great location, just way too small”
Reviews.Author: littleappleNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cute and nicely renovated. Pros: Comfortable bed and linens Modern clean innovative dÃ©cor Staff was friendly and helpful â€“ especially the door men (they seemed to know more about local restaurants etc than the front desk!) Great breakfast Fantastic location Good price Nice bathroom (albeit smallish) Accommodated a way early check in without blinking an eye Cons: Elevator was antiquated and took way too long most of the time The room was just too small (we had room 1107). I pride myself as a New Yorker in putting up with small rooms, but this room takes the cake â€“ and it was a Priority Club Platinum room upgrade too! There was literally only enough room to walk in the door, open the closet door, pull the 1 small chair from under the desk, and walk around both sides of the queen bed. No dresser to speak of either â€“ just 3 filing cabinet drawers in the closet. Only 1 small of center window in the room. I knew the hotel was sold out so I didnâ€™t ask to see any other rooms so I can only speak for the 1 room. To sum up â€“ This is a really cute little hotel with great service and some nice amenities, but due to the size of the rooms I donâ€™t think I would stay there again â€“ which is strange, because small rooms donâ€™t generally bother me too much, but it was just THAT small. If you find a great rate on this hotel and really arenâ€™t going to be in the room or if you are by yourself it could be a nice deal.

Reviews.Title: “4 Night Stay- Very Pleasant Modern feel hotel”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn express, also know as Hotel Cass, underwent a 15 billion dollar refurb thank goodness. I book for 4 nights, got a ridiculously low rate of $40 a night all inclusive as i booked a hotel/flight package with lastminute.com. I was sceptical thinking i would be put in a room reserved for priceline/orbitz bookers but i had a normal hotel room.i even got some extras as im a priority reward club holder. Hotel staff were all nice except one who needed cheering up, doormen helpful ordering cabs and giving out umbrellers when it rained. breakfast was good choice, not many hotels in chaicago offer complimentary brekkie. Location was great, a mile from the lake shore and navy pier but its a nice safe walk. Loads of bars around, hard rock is a 5 minute walk, excalibur nightclub even closer. John hancock tower is a 15 min walk, the mag mile is 2-3 mins away allthough i was dissapointed with the mag mile. Its nothing on 5th avenue in NYC Rooms are small but modern, LCD tv on the wall with 5-6 HD channels and a good range of other channels. Bathroom is modern, no probs whatsoever, choice of soft-hard pillows is a nice touch. Free wifi was useful I would recommend this hotel for the price its great, i cant see a reason to go sheraton or hilton next time im in town. All it lacks is a bar but there are plenty close by. If im really critical id say the cleanleness isnt too great when you walk around the hotel lobby and hallways, in my room where the skirting boards meet the carpet it was full of dust and the coloured carpet really showed it up.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: nate269
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by touching on the topic of the hotel itself. Some of the pictures on this website depict the hotel before it was renovated and converted to a Holiday Inn Express. It is much nicer now. Secondly, on the topic of the rooms. Sure, they are small, but one must consider that this is a historic hotel from the 1920s. Not your average roadside, "Cookie-Cutter" Holiday Inn Express with giant "suites". The rooms are modern, and serve their purpose. Upon check-in, the process was fast and efficient, and the staff was courteous, and up to standard, and the clerk was even willing to switch our room type to a different bed. When I arrived in my room, it was clean on the surface, however there were some issues that could have been prevented by housekeeping, such as a hair in the bed, and a burned out light bulb in the lamp (maintenance did replace). Additionally, there was a big black spot in the shower. The breakfast was delicious, however the staff couldn't have been any less friendly. Neither of the three breakfast hostesses were greeting or talking guests. They would bring food out and then go back in the kitchen and talk and eat. (door was propped open). Overall good hotel, clean, safe, comfortable, but not amazing. Would recommend however.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE Chicago!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbwire65
Reviews.Content: Nice and cozy, room maybe a little small, but who cares? I was in only to sleep. And when it was too cold outside, the lobby provided comfortable armchairs and a fireplace... Everybody was very friendly in spite of the cold weather - I'd say warm people in the windy city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: sjtParis
Reviews.Content: Really great location, nice renovation job, good free breakfast, friendly staff....what more do you need? The rooms are small - maybe for a,ericans used to junior suites - but for us europeans, the rooms are normal sized. With everything you could need in them. As for the corridors being noarrow? I'm not sure which corridors this person saw, but I didn't see a narrow corridor..... really great hotel in a location that would be hard to beat for the money. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, room small, facilities disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TJDora
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Very convenient to restaurants, entertainment and shopping. The rooms are very small. Not what you would expect in a Holiday Inn Express. The room was clean and the service was good. The public areas are disappointing. There is a lack of tables in the breakfast area. You have to go to the second floor for vending. The front desk staff was pretty good. I doubt I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fanastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Bex_K
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through their website, we were there for 4 nights and had a great time. Have to agree with the other reviews in that the rooms are tiny, we had a twin room....the beds got in, desk and 2 chairs, the 42 inch TV was mounted on the wall and we had to work round them. As we were out most of the time this wasn't a problem. The staff here were all excellent, with a special mention to the maids and the doormen. We were always greeted nicely asked if we needed directions/cabs etc and the rooms were all clean and tidy. Breakfast was also excellent, and more than expected. There were 2 PC's in the breakfast room with free internet access and I believe that there was free wi-fi connection. 2 blocks from the Mag Mile and 3 blocks from the river, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cass - would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: MaybeBabette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights at the Hotel Cass. The rooms are small by US standards but they reminded me of the hotels in Europe! The location is convenient to the Mag Mile and the trains. The hotel staff was very helpful, responsive and welcoming. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobics beware!”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenj
Reviews.Content: If you are in the least bit claustrophic, beware. My room was clean, but TINY! It was about the size of a small bedroom. No room for a desk or a chest of drawers. The HDTV was mounted on the wall. The bathroom sink had no counter space. I had to open my suitcase on the bed when I needed to get something from it. Even the outside hallways are extremely narrow. True, its a bargain compared to other hotels in the immediate neighborhood, but I just felt too uncomfortable in the room to spend any time in it (other than sleeping).

Reviews.Title: “Possible Credit Card Scam”
Reviews.Author: ScrunchTheCat
Reviews.Content: When I checked in the hotel put a $50 hold on my credit card for "incidentals." I was assured that this charge would be erased when I checked out if there were no additional charges to my room. There were not. However, the charge was never removed from my credit card. I called my bank, which told me to call the hotel and tell them to FAX them a signed note on letterhead saying that they would release the charges. The woman at the front desk tried to argue with me about whose fault it was that the charges were not removed, and then summarily transferred me to the voice mailbox of the Accounting and HR representative. I left this person a detailed voice message but have not heard back.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vmoon8965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express the 1st week of August. This hotel has been completely remodeled and doesn't in any way resemble the older pictures submitted by travelers. The photos on the hotel website are accurate as this is a very nice hotel. The good: The location was hard to beat! 2 blocks off the Mag mile with parking right around the corner. Easy walking to all main downtown attractions. The breakfast was fine with many cold options. I was disappointed that they didn't have any fresh fruit and were out of milk which made having cereal out of the question. It is hard to find a reasonably priced hotel with a breakfast in the downtown. The bad: Quite possibly the smallest hotel room we have ever been in. We had a room with one queen and the room was not much larger than the bed. If you do not spend much time in the room, it should be no problem. I would not recommend for a long stay. We were there during a tornado warning and there did not seem to be any information available on what to do in the event of this kind of emergency. All in all, not a bad stay. If the price was right, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location, not for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lolly1925
Reviews.Content: The main plus for this hotel is location, location, location. Within a couple of blocks you will find yourself on Mag Mile and there are loads of great restaurants nearby Unos, Duos, ESPN Zone, Chilis, Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, CPK to name a few so you won't go hungry. The rooms were on the small side but were tastefully decorated and were clean - big LCD TV on the wall at the bottom of the bed but be careful - there wasn't enough room to walk past the bed without bumping your head on the TV plus we didn't seem to get all the TV channels. It was supposed to be HD - we were lucky if we had 2 HD channels. Thought about complaining to reception but they always seemed busy. Had free WIFI in the room which was a big plus. My biggest gripe was the breakfast area - there were not enough tables to start and I don't know if it was because we stayed at a particularly busy time but you had to queue to get to the breakfast bar and then most of the food/cutlery/cups was gone and we had to wait longer to get a spoon or a fork! There didn't seem to be enough staff to clear what tables there were so if you found a spare table, chances are you had to share it with the previous occupants leftovers. Also the other strange thing was the disco music in the elevators! Im not sure If I would stay at this hotel again, it would be dependant upon the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, creepy and technologically challenged rooms”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadEditor
Reviews.Content: Overall, the staff was excellent; unfortunately, certain aspects of the hotel were horrible. I could not get a cell phone call anywhere in my room during my entire stay, my alarm clock had no reception, and my tv couldn't receive half of the stations. To make matters worse, I found hair in my bathroom in addition to a tick in my sink. The tick was there when I arrived, so I know I didn't bring it. And one day when I came back to the room, all the lights had been left on and the trash can was in the middle of the hallway--as if someone was still lurking in the room, waiting to pop out and scare the heck out of me. Good breakfast and comfortable beds, but I won't be staying again. Be advised that most cabbies won't know where this is (name has changed recently); make sure to mention the Wabash address.

Reviews.Title: “Best rate for great location”
Reviews.Author: 28kate
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. Right in the middle of it all, and a great rate. Best of all, the staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. I would recommend to anyone. This is not a luxury hotel, but what you get for the money is a fabulous value.

Reviews.Title: “Cool but small room, pleasant staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: katarzynathegreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and I was surprised how close it was to all the good stuff! Literally a hop and skip away to Michigan Ave! The room was small, but it was tastefully done--ours looked like the room from the picture on the website. If we wanted to spend more time in the room, I would have felt cramped, but we had a limited amount of time in the city, so it was good for the $140 we paid. The view from the room was nothing to write home about, but there was a nice flat screen tv in it and the bathroom was VERY CLEAN! There were some drunk people yelling in the hallway in the middle of the night, but they quieted down pretty quickly. I think that because of the location near many, many bars, that's to be expected. Staff was pleasant and helpful. There was a free breakfast with fresh fruit, bacon, eggs, cereal, etc.--the only problem was that people left their plates behind on the tables and kitchen staff didn't clean up those tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: romi120
Reviews.Content: Six of us drove from Toronto for a roadtrip to Chicago the weekend of April 19. After a long drive, we arrived at the hotel greeted by the doorman who was ready and eager to help us with our bags. The location of the hotel was perfect. Walking distance to everywhere you wanted to go. It was great because i did not want to drive another kilometre while in the City. Had my fill of driving to and fro. Very close the Michigan Ave. Magnificent mile. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, shopping, nightlife and tourist spots. Rooms: We had 2 rooms for 6 people and it was perfect. The rooms were clean, tidy and nicely decorated. The HD tvs were a great touch. The towels were soft and the beds were firm. The rooms were on the smaller side. The staff was friendly and always helpful with directions, recommending restaurants and other points of interest. The hotel offers free continental breakfast every morning which is perfect if you are on the go and complimentary coffe, tea and hot chocolate throughout the day. The lobby is beautiful and welcoming with plenty of places to sit and meet. Overall, my friends and I had a pleasant experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Size of a tuna can”
Reviews.Author: jeanjeanjean
Reviews.Content: Great location, but no restaurant, no fitness center. And my room was TINY...the size of a tuna can. Stayed for a week, and felt too cramped to do anything. Noisy hallways, and I was on the top floor! Not good for a business travelor, that needs bigwork space, room serivce, night time drink, etc. Great for a weekend shopping trip with the girls, if you all get seperate rooms! Great customer service though! Won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: OhioMama3
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have commented... "the rooms are small". It's true. If you are one who needs to spread out, have special places to tuck clothes away and hang items up, this hotel choice may not be for you. However, if you're looking for a hotel that's very reasonably priced, has a great location, provides a nice breakfast bar that's free each morning, is nicely appointed and very clean... this may be a perfect match for you. My mother & I stayed here with my two girls for 3 nights. The American Girl Store, my daughters' favorite, was an easy walk. We walked everywhere, with exception of the Science and Industry Museum. We felt safe at all times & really enjoyed being able to get out and explore the city on our own. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, helpful, and eager to please. If you are coming to Chicago to get out and see the city during the day & want to come home to a comfortable bed and very clean place everynight.... check out Hotel Cass Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Modern”
Reviews.Author: sheluvsblu
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night while visiting Chicago to see an Oprah taping. We needed a clean room for a short overnight trip and the Holiday Inn Hotel Cass did the trick. The red line train is two blocks away on E. Grand Ave and taxis are easy to access in front. Restaurants surround the area. Each staff member we encountered was pleasant and helpful. The lobby is nicely updated with a fireplace and sitting area. A complimentary breakfast is available beginning at 6:30am on weekdays in the lobby and I was impressed by the spread. The room, though compact, was clean, modern and agreeable for the price. We had a room on the street side offering us a nice view of the sears tower and other high rises. On the negative side, the walls are thin and I could hear our neighborâ€™s TV and sirens from outside. A housekeeping cart was parked in front of our room making it impossible to enter without moving it and thankfully, we did because it remained outside our door our entire visit. The bathrooms, while nice, are tiny with no counter space. And although the hotel has been updated, perhaps the bathroom piping has not because it made a funny, loud belching sound every time the toilet flushed. But these concerns were minor during our one night stay and I was satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Treetops2
Reviews.Content: Not your average Holiday Inn Express! This hotel had an elegant feel just a couple blocks off Michigan Avenue. Old brick building, nice lobby, great staff. The doorman was exceptional. Room are quite small but nicely appointed. The location can't be beat...walk to everything..shopping, dining, Art Institute, Millennium Park. Very reasonably priced for the great location. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Chicago and would recommend it to friends also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: 123john
Reviews.Content: I have not read all the reviews here but the hotel is certainly a far cry from the bad reviews it received in 2003. The rooms are basic yet pleasant. It has been remodled in recent times. The bathrooms were new and spotless. The rooms don't look chique as they do in the Holiday Inn website but don't be discouraged by this. I am fussy about hotels and I had no complaints. What surprised me the most, was the outstanding service by the staff from the doorman, check in, and housekeeping. I would have thought I was staying in the most expensive hotel in Chicago by the high level of service here. It was so good that although I have stayed at places a little nicer in the same price class in the neighborhood, the service really stood out and I will stay here again because of it. They had a "real" complimentary breakfast with scrambled eggs and cinamon rolls on the menu, one of the better free breakfasts i have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Cass”
Reviews.Author: choo-choodaz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Cass/Holiday Inn express in Chicago. From arriving to departing we found the staff freindly and welcoming.Yes the rooms are on the small side but are in good condition,..bed was comfortable,flat screen tv on the wall,in room safe,iron and board etc,....the bathroom was very small but in excellent condition.The location is excellent,we walked everywhere,mag mile,sears tower,hancock observation deck,grant park,navy pier.Plenty of restraunts in the area and a starbucks over the road.We never had the free breakfast,but helped ourselves to coffee when we returned to the hotel in the afternoon.All in all we would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to chicago,you just can,t beat it for price and location.We will definatley return to the hotel cass when visiting this great city again,...next time in the warmer months of the year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lizottumwa
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay at the Holiday Inn Express/Hotel Cass. We paid $90/night, which we thought was a real bargain for the close proximity to all the sights/shopping we were taking in. The lobby is very nicely decorated in a modern theme, as are the rooms. The rooms are SMALL, but it really didn't bother us for a three night stay. The hotel staff we met were excellent, both the front desk personnel and the two doormen (the doormen were really top notch). We thought the breakfast was great for being included in the room price - they had all the regular colds (danishes/muffins/bagels/cereals/yogurt/fruit), plus bacon/sausage/gravy/eggs. The eggs were not hot, so that wasn't good, but the rest was very good. We walked to Ed Debovics (daughter loved this place), Giardano's Pizza, Lawry's Prime Rib, Michigan Avenue, the Lego Store, plus much, much more. Short cab rides (under $8) got us to Sears Tower, Navy Pier and Macy's State Street. This hotel is so centrally located, that for the price, unless you are claustrophobic, it is a definate must .

Reviews.Title: “It's easy to reccomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoser9
Reviews.Content: This property goes well beyond HIEâ€™s reputation of a Spartan & no frills approach to room amenities and locale. As a platinum Priority Awards member, I stay at many IC properties every year, and this was the best property I stayed at this year by far (sorry Holiday Inn SFO Golden Gateway). This property doesn't look like a Holiday Inn Express except for the "Holiday Inn Express" signage above the front door. A doorman opened the door and welcomed us, leading us to the very impressive and simple dÃ©cor in the front lobby. I arrived at 1000hrs and was promptly checked in with my traveling companion without incident. The front desk staff werenâ€™t snide or rude by any means, but were rather quite proficient and genuine I must say. Some properties you can get great service and understand how they can be rude to other travelers that submit reviews on here, but I really didn't see how that could be possible, with the front desk clerks that I dealt with, at least. The front desk staff were not abrupt or rude, neither were they obnoxious or phony. After the entire checkin process, they even asked if I have "any questions about the local area", and a map was offered. We were assigned room 605. The hallways were extremely small and cramped and so was the room. There was enough space to walk and leave my luggage. The usage of a flat screen tv (with HD channels!) was a good choice. Despite the small size, the room made very good use of space. The double bed was spacious, thatâ€™s all I care about. Remember that this is central Chicago, not suburban Kansas, so the rooms are going to be sized accordingly. The decoration of the room was incredible and way beyond what you would expect for a HIE. The bathroom was small but the usage of a wall mounted counter was wise. The shower was great but the inner shower curtain was full of mildew. Otherwise, no complains with the maintenance. The view from the room was, well, claustrophobic. I didnâ€™t mind it too much and I think it was kind of nice and a bit charming, to be honest. Everything in the room worked; plugins, 802.11, lights, climate control, everything. I always find holiday inn express hotels to have the best service due to the simple approach to the manner in which they operate. However, â€˜The Cassâ€™ went way beyond what I have experienced with past HIE properties. The propertyâ€™s doorman acted way more professionally and genuinely than doormen that I have seen at a Westin or Hyatt. He would offer to summon cabs, ask if you knew where you were going, he would even say 'welcome back' when I drunkenly stumbled into the hotel at 9pm. Service all around was great. I wasn't very demanding this trip, however, so I cannot say how good the service can get. The breakfast area was superb; at any hour (even after drinks at the late hour of, yes, 9pm) you can help yourself to coffee, tea, milk, and yogurt. There were even two computers that you can use (gratis) which are hidden behind the breakfast lounge. What I think would be a nice touch for this space thatâ€™s largely vacant 20 hours a day is if they had evening snacks, maybe even an honor bar? I know it's not very holiday inn expressâ€™y, but it would be very boutique. The breakfast was also great, albeit of no nutritional value except the bananas. There was cereal, cinnamon buns, and a "hot food coming soon!" sign where the hot food should go. Along with the lack of any nutritional breakfasts, my beef is that this breakfast only ran from 0630-0930, but I suppose this caters best to their business traveler/middle aged tourist demographic that dominates this hotel. Check out was great. Hours before checkout, we asked for a late check out of 1600hrs, but we were told that we would have to pay a half day rate for this. I asked the latest free check out that we could get which was 1330hrs. I played the 'I'm platinum' card and they pushed over to 1500hrs. I think that was a fair compromise (although it's a long stride from the westin's 4pm no questions asked guarantee). The check out was under 60 seconds and without incident. The location was amazing, you had a jewel osco for your grocery and cheap liquor needs four blocks south west, CTA three blocks (grand/state station?) south and west, mag mile three blocks east, and lots of great places to eat within blocks. the Hancock Observatory and MCA are very close to the east as well. Tip with the Hancock Observatory: go to the bar and buy a $12 (triple) martini. Not only do you get a drink for the same price as one in Toronto or some other Scandinavian/Canadian city, you can enjoy it from the 95th floor overlooking Chicago in a very unpretentious environment (dress business casual at least, unless you want to look like an [--]). Besides, it's the same cost as admission to the family-filled observatory anyways. Apart from my suggestions that the breakfast should run later, evening snacks would be a nice touch, and that the shower curtain in 605 needs to get changed (badly), nothing could have gone better. This property will be my first choice for a future stay in Chicago at any rate. The managers here know how to run a hotel and it shows. Book this property, you will not regret it. And if the other reviews deter you: remember that this is a Holiday Inn Express, not a W. If you pay $150/night, you get $150/night in amenities. If you want the W, fork over $400/night.

Reviews.Title: “It's hard to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dalialuna
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Cass in October 2007. It had recently opened after an extensive renovation. Unfortunately, the rooms are very small, with little room to place one's luggage and only a few small drawers inside the closet. We encountered many problems. One night the thermostat didn't function and we couldn't lower the heat (it was promptly fixed the next morning). We were caught without hot or cold water for several hours one morning, while the hotel was working on a plumbing problem. And our door had to be fixed because it kept jamming shut, requiring us to push hard with our shoulders to try to open it (this was eventually fixed too). The elevator dinged loudly every time it arrived at our floor and it woke me up early every morning. I essentially ignored the meager breakfast, taking only tea and a piece of fruit to start my day. Oh, and one other irritation for me--there was one lamp between the two beds, but no private reading lamps; so turning on the lamp meant disturbing my friend. On the plus side, the doormen are helpful and super-friendly, and the hotel is in a central location. By the time taxes were added onto our bill, we were paying about $285 a night (and this was with a AAA discount that applied for one of the nights only). At checkout time, my friend matter of factly pointed out to the supervisor at the desk our problems with the thermostat, the lack of water, and the door that jammed. She very kindly offered to give us a $200 discount on our bill. Nonetheless, I cannot recommend this hotel. At that price, we encountered too many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Small Rooms Never again”
Reviews.Author: average1
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I spent 1 Saturday night at this Holiday Inn Express. We found the room to be clean but very cramped with 2 double beds. This hotel was formerly known as the Hotel Cass. Unfortunately when the hotel was renovated, the rooms were not enlarged and are cramped with odd shapes. Our room had only one lamp, so we didn't have a reading light. The room had only 2 cups, no hairdryer or kleenix. The walls were not soundproof so we heard the elevator dings, outside sirens and the neighbors shower. The room lacked a place to put suitcases, had no table or chair. We had actually changed from a room next to the elevator to avoid hearing the elevator going up/ down. Breakfast was cold foods with a sign indicating hot food "coming soon" which meant sometieme at a future date. The room had a tiny closet with a safe, the mattess was comfortable and staff accomodating. Location near Michigan Ave. The room rate seemed reasonable until we discovered the disappointing room. We expected more from a Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “very small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: DrDannyK
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference and booked the hotel through the conference's housing commity. 215$/night. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very small. couldn't get around the bed without bending out of the way of the flat screen TV mounted on the wall. TV is flat screen but most channels are distorted because it is a 16:9 screen. No movie on demand either. Breakfast was very simple. Very poorly furnished. Only a tiny desk with a simple chair. No couch. Mind you, there wasn't any room for anything else. The worst thing was that the room (#1606) was close to the elevators and the wooshing of the elevators kept waking me up all night long. Very noisy, I heard similar complaints from other guests. When the hotel staff could not find me another room (they said it was all booked, even though I know people were checking out) I checked out and stayed at the sheraton for 220/night. In short, too small and noisy for the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Holiday Inn express formerly cass Hotel in chicago”
Reviews.Author: can1972
Reviews.Content: The Holiday inn Express Hotel, on N. Wabash is the former Cass Hotel. The renovations were extensive and evident. The lobby was done in an art deco theme and had alot of space to eat the Holiday Inn Express breakfast in the morning. There were numerous tables, sofas, chairs, flat screen tv's arranged in a comfortable way. The linens, beds,bathroom fixtures and flat screen TV's are all new:however, the rooms, hallways and elevators are small. If this is an issue for you, do not book this hotel. The location is wonderful, very close to the Water Tower where you catch the buses and trolleys. There are plenty of restaurantsnear by from expensive to chairns and fast food. The price was a bargain compared to other hotels I checked with a similar location. It was wonderful to be so close to Michigan Ave and all forms of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: flossy_h
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at the Hotel Cass. First time in Chicago and its convienent to all locations. Nearest CTA is Grand 2 blocks away so we got the Blue line from O'hare to downtown then changed for the red line to Grand all for $2. The hotel is 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue and there are a few resturants nearby, we loved the Grand Lux Cafe, huge portions and great food. The breakfast at the hotel was a good selection. toast, muffins, bagels, cereal etc. Staff were helpful espically Steve the doorman We paid $208 a night which I thought was good value and if returning to Chicago Hotel Cass would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Vote Yes for Cass...”
Reviews.Author: Pie97
Reviews.Content: First time at the Cass and we were very impressed, just went through a renovation and they are very competitive with others in the area. More a boutique hotel, nice flat panel TV's in room and very comfortable beds!! Decor is modern and the lobby is very cool.Stayed one night and we will always come here for a quite nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Goes Trendy: Flashy and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NaomiLA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Cass Hotel many times but my latest visit was after its new Holiday Inn affiliation and recent renovation. Despite its facelift, the Cass is in many ways still the original Cass. The main difference now is the price, my room cost $230 a night only because I was attending a convention in the city. Otherwise, it would've been $330. Unfortunately, I saw nothing substantial that accounted for the mark-up. The rooms at the Cass are very, very small, ideal for small folks with little luggage. Despite its size, my room was newly redone along IKEA lines. But it was tight with 2 double beds. The rooms are so small they're uninviting. They're not meant to be relaxed in. The Cass made sense before as a budget hotel (then a room was $80 a night) that provided a place to lay your head but no more. Unfortunately the hipster decor couldn't remedy the situation. Also, half of my floor was still under renovation and big fans were working 24/7 to dry some paint. One morning, I woke up to an electric drill. On both mornings that I was there, I was also unable to open my door from the inside. Maintenance staff said the door was stuck to its frame because the paint wasn't dry and the old wooden door had expanded from the humidity. It was a lot of inconvenience for $220 a night. The best thing about the Cass, then and now, is its location. But for the money, you can find a more spacious, luxurious room at one of the many hotels nearby. I came hoping to see some of my old budget motel and I did, just underneath the facelift for a name brand price.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again anytime”
Reviews.Author: KathyGinger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Cass Hotel in 2004. (Yes I know it's a bit late to write a review but better laten than never :-) ) I liked it. I come from Germany, traveled by myself and the rates of this hotel allowed me to stay for two weeks in Chicago. It's in a great location (the House Of Blues is within walking distance for all you music lovers, so is the lake and some shopping areas), it was very clean and actually quite comfy - but I guess that depends on how much money you usually have and the places you usually stay in. The staff was very friendly and helpfull and I felt safe at all times, but then again I traveled half the world by myself and hardly ever get scared. I walked from the bus or the House of Blues to the hotel at all times at night and never had a problem with it. It was quiet at night, the rooms are pretty big (we Europeans always say that about Hotel rooms in the US), the water in the bathroom worked - what more can you ask for? I had a bagel and a coffee downstairs in the small cafe/diner/deli and that was enough to start my day. So yes, I'd bookmarked the address for that hotel and would stay there again. Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Not great!”
Reviews.Author: Honey510
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel August 2005. The location was great but the hotel itself is in need of moderisation. I didn't pay very much for the room as I got a special rate due to it being a stopover hotel for a TrekAmerica tour and it's a good job because I wouldn't have wanted to pay full price for such a pokey, old fashioned room. I am usully quite content to stay in cheap and cheerful hotels seeing as I never spend very much time in the room, but my room at the Cass was tiny, with chintz bedspreads and wallpaper, and there was grime on the skirting boards and window sills. The place just didn't feel clean. Staff seemed pre-occupied when approached and the lifts were very slow. I got the feeling that because this hotel is used by a lot of students and 20 somethings (i.e. the TrekAmerica crowd) the staff just can't be bothered. I wouldn't chose to stay here again. Shame about the hotel because I loved Chicago and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: scandiman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single bed room, #1000. Cold, no heat in hotel, noisy from neighbors and elevator, tilting floors, view of a wall. Maybe there are better rooms in this place but I simply went to another hotel since the heat was off throughout. Beware the hot water when taking a shower if your neighbor flushes their toilet. OUCH! Best thing about this hotel is the location. Not worth spending any waking moments in the room. If I had to stay here again, I would ask for a south facing room away from the elevator and up enough stories to see over the adjacent structure. Street side (east) is close to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martrese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cass to visit relatives (coincidentally during Lollapalooza - August 4-7, 2006). You can't beat $89/night for two blocks off Michigan Ave! Very close to the red line "L" and the Lakeshore Drive bike/running path (which I used extensively - gorgeous!). Even though the place was full of rowdy concert-goers, our room was very quiet - we slept quite well. The elevators are slow and the decor is very no-frills, but the room was clean and we were very happy with not spending an arm and a leg. The Cass isn't for those seeking a night of luxury downtown, but rather those needing a clean place to sleep while checking out the many things to do in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Retina
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and we were pleased that the hotel exceeded our expections. For a budget hotel this one is fantastic. The location can't be beat - minutes from Michigan Ave. We booked through their own web site and received the best deal - $89.00/night. The room was big, roomy and very clean. While the decor was plain, the beds were comfortable. There was a small refrigerator and extra sink, but no microwave. The bathroom was spotless. The view from our room was lovely and even though it was July, we didn't need to turn on the air conditioner once. The elevators are painfully slow, but big enough to fit six or seven people with luggage. Staff were extremely nice and helpful - we were able to check in three hours before the posted time. On our last day we stored our luggage at the front desk for the afternoon before our evening departure. The cafe provides an inexpensive, tasty cooked to order breakfast. The hotel was full of tourists from all over the world and had a European feel. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stuff”
Reviews.Author: baz3333
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Cass recently. Great location. Handy cafe for breakfast. Every member of staff was helpful, friendly and efficient.
