It is close to Michigan Avenue and bus routes, Hard Rock Cafe, Blue Chicago (both). $15 cab ride to Kingston Mines, B.L.U.E.S., and Rosa'a Lounge. They have obviously read previous reviews as the towels were fine and fluffy(ish)!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a brilliant price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cass Hotel at the end of March/beginning of April for Wrestlemania 22 weekend. This hotel is in a brilliant location, minutes from the magnificent mile and starbucks! We requested a high floor and got exactly that - the top 16th floor. The hotel was clean and tidy, the room, although smallish was adequate for our stay. The Cass even has a cafe/breakfast area open in the mornings. Internet access was also very helpful ($1 for 5 minutes). All major downtown atraction were within easy reach of the hotel and the train system is easy to get to grips with. Took two trips on the CTA to Rosemont for the WWE Hall of Fame 2006 and again for Wrestlemania 22 - with trains running every few minutes. Excellent hotel - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: omoshiroi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cass May 18-21,2006. Big restaurant show in town raising most hotel rooms to outrageous prices. We got a decent sized double for $89/night -- less than half of what was showing up anywhere in the downtown area. The check in time is three but when we arrived at one we were given our room right away. The hotel is in the Near North area -- just a few blocks from a Red Line subway stop, close to lots of great restaurants and shops. The location cannot be beat and the rooms, while, basic, are acceptable and the staff very pleasant. We chose to stay on the the top floor to get a view, this was fine except that one of the two elevators was broken most of the time we were there (and the hotel was completely full.) Unlike in other reviews the soaps and shampoo provided were very nice (Neutrogena) but the towels were rather worn. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were well cleaned. The biggest negative was poor water pressure in the shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all, if you won't be spending a lot of time in your room (and there's no need to with all that's going on in the area.) this is a great bargain. Don't know how long the deals will last as the hotel is about to be rennovated. Even if you don't stay at the Cass, check out the lounge (The Sea of Happiness) -- $2.50 draft beers, darts, and a fun (though not trendy) crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: kevboy
Reviews.Content: First of all, you're probably not going to beat the price you'll pay here, especially during peak periods. The room are basic -- cheapie soap, no shampoo, for example -- but the bed was fine and things were clean. A little worn around the edges, but clean. The TV had cable, even HBO, if for some reason you need to spend extra time in the room. Elevators a bit slow, lots of teenagers and touring Europeans. Check out the in-hotel bar: $2.50 drafts, and you can free wireless internet access from there while you're drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife was in Chicago for a convention, and I tagged along to see the sights. We read the other reviews, and it really comes down to expectations. The Cass was built in the 1920s and had been in operation ever since. The rooms are a little warn, but have been kept up fairly well. Ours had: fresh paint, TV, new windows, window AC and steam radiator heat (centrally controlled). It was very pleasant. If you are looking for luxury or even frills, this is not your place. But the hotel is safe, clean and the staff is great. Everyone we talked to in the hotel said roughly the same thing, "X was lacking, but it is a great hotel." NOTE: The Cass is NOT handicap accessible, there are stairs and tight halls in parts of the hotel. Canes and crutches will do OK, but wheelchairs will not. Specifics: Many have commented on the bathrooms, towels, beds and sheets. Our bathroom was slightly updated from the original 1920â€™s bathroom, with a GFC outlet and a new sink. (The tub was the original enamel-coated cast iron tub. I am a big guy, and having solid footing is nice, unlike the flimsy plastic tubs you get with new construction) The towels were fine. They are not Fieldcrest Canon, just low end hotel grade, and the same was true for the bedding. The beds were a bit springy, but the pillows are great. The main features of the Cass is the price and the location. We stayed for $84 ($97 after tax) a night. The hotel is located between Michigan & State and Erie & Ontario. I did an internet search and found within 6 blocks (0.25 Miles) more than: 85 restaurants, 14 major department stores, 8 grocery stores, 7 clubs, 3 shopping centers, and a movie theater, and hundreds of other businesses, coffee shops, and so on. If you are in Chicago to hang out at a hotel, go somewhere else. If you are in Chicago to see Chicago, you canâ€™t get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very simple but very well located !!!”
Reviews.Author: Flavio_C
Reviews.Content: The goals of Cass Hotel are the excellent location and low cost. I made a extensive research and I didnÂ´t find a downtown hotel cheaper than Cass. For my surprise, it was very well cleaned despite the old age of the building. This hotel is very good for someone who travels on a budget and wants to stay in an excellent location near the "fever" of this outstanding city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right-Cheap Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: asingerkeating
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read about this hotel were very accurate. If you want expensive towels, shampoos and such, then you will be very disappointed with the hotel. If you want to be downtown right in the middle of all the fun without spending a fortune, and you want a safe, clean hotel with a courteous staff, then you will be very satisfied. I traveled with my two male business partners. One can be kind of finicky so he wasn't really thrilled with the hotel (until he found out how much money we saved, and used on good food and wine later!) and the other has traveled all over the world and is a little more forgiving. Make sure to take your own travel size shampoo and conditioner, and taking your own towel isn't a bad idea. Or just buy a Chicago souvenir beach towel on your first day and use that. The towels definately need replaced. The beds are small, but the linens are clean and the beds are comfy. My remote control didn't work great, I think it needed a new battery, but I didn't come to Chicago to watch TV, so I made do. The rooms are small, actually tiny. If you ever traveled to Europe during college on a budget, then you probably stayed at hotels just like this one. But the best thing about the hotel is it's location. You are only a block or two from some of the best food, shopping and nightlife in the US. Go with VERY low expectations and you won't be disappointed. The neighborhood is safe, the hotel is well maintained overall, and I felt very safe there. The staff was very accomodating. My purse was stolen (be careful...Chicago is a thief/scammer paradise...don't put your purse over the back of your chair, do NOT stop for anyone offering a shoe shine, and don't set your purse at your feet) and the staff was so helpful with calling the police, letting me make calls and use the internet to get all my cards cancelled. I will stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved big here to spend elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Kpthook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from Nov. 4-7. We had a great time in Chicago and a great stay at the Cass. I made reservations directly since my online booking experiences of late have left me a little skiddish (ask for one thing get something totally different). The staff was friendly, the room was clean, no problems with housekeeping. Much better than at other far more expensive places we stayed at. We stayed in room 702 and were very satisfied. Plenty of hot water, enough TV channels. As others have mentioned bring your own shampoo, we brought towels but what was there was acceptable, to each his own. The bed was OK, the room size was OK. We were there to see Chicago, not hang in the room all day. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. As others have noted you can not beat the location. Short walk to Navy Pier, Water Tower, right around the corner to Michigan Ave. Restaurants, shops, public transit, both El and bus, was perfect. Very safe feeling, if you've been to Wash. DC you know what I mean. The Cass Hotel website is very informative with good info. We flew into O'Hare took the El just like the info said, no problems. If you want to save the big bucks to spend elsewhere, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cass hotel is just what it claims 'Clean room, comfortable price'. It is in a fantastic loctaion, in this beautiful city. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go, even the Lincoln Park Zoo (although it is bit further, but well worth going too). Go up the John Hancock Centre if you get the chance it is just a short walk from the hotel and you get amazing view of Chicago. We really enjoyed our stay, good sized clean rooms, with room for clothes, a desk, bedside tables, televison (great range of channels) and nice bathrooms. Internet in the hotel loby, ice machine, there is also a bar attached although I can't comment on it as we didn't use it. Hotel is in easy walking distance CTA station which is a cheap , quick and easy way to get to O'Hare airport. Overall a very enjoyable stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The quintessential cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: For less than 80 dollars (including tax) you get... a hotel room about a block from the Magnificent Mile for under 80 dollars. You don't get a coffee maker, hair dryer, iron or alarm clock - not even shampoo. (Since my last visit, they've also stopped leaving pens.) Also, I doubt anyone has ever stolen the rather small, rather rough towels. The furnishings of my room seem shabbier than I'd recalled, and this place may have the slowest elevators of any hotel in Chicago. So much for negatives. One doesn't go to Chicago to stay in a hotel room, and I've always had a decent night's sleep here. The cable TV service is actually pretty good and includes at least one station where you can always get a local weather forecast quickly. There's a cheap coffee shop on the main floor where you can get (only) breakfast without paying for a dinner, and a coin laundromat. The desk help does what little it can in terms of info and advice. The original Pizzeria Uno and Due (the first "branch") are within a block, buses and the Red Line El within two. Note: the immediate area can seem deserted and spooky at night. If you demand creature comforts, look elsewhere. If you want a cheap room where you can sleep and keep your stuff, this could be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnLetchworth_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the the thirteenth floor, room 1412, and it was exactly what it said it was "downtown location without the downtown price". Room was clean and was cleaned every day. There was a fridge in the room which was good for drinks etc. Friendly staff and excellent value and if you intend to be out of your room every day and do not need all of the extras for which you pay double in other hotels (pool, gym etc.) then this is the place. A few minutes from Michigan Ave. Get a CTA pass for $20 for the week and get all the trains and busses plus your trip from O'Hare and back.

Reviews.Title: “Please Clean my Room”
Reviews.Author: shellmar
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere basic and cheap to stay in Chicago since we would only be staying a couple of nights, and our priority was sightseeing and being out and about. Having said that, while all we wanted was something basic, we assumed a certain bottom line - like having your bed made and rubbish emptied daily. Nope. Our room was never cleaned. Despite calling this to the attention of reception, not even an apology was forthcoming. The response was 2 no. clean towels. Not a set. 2 towels. And no cleaning. The hotel is in a good locaiton. It's a bit rough around the edges and would probably be a lot more pleasant with a lick of paint here and there and more modern furniture. But with all the best will in the world... it is a little bit grotty. Even for a cheap hotel. It just isn't clean (or cleaned!!!), and doesn't add to an enjoyable experience. The staff, while not blatantly rude, are definitely not friendly nor helpful. If you are anyway sensitive to these things, or generally expect a certain basic standard, then don't waste your money. You'd be better paying that little bit extra for a slightly nicer place. If these things don't bother you; and you would sleep anywhere with a roof, then you'll be fine. Bottom line: yep, great location. But, conspicuously, that's the only thing even the hotel itself promotes. There's more to a hotel than its location, and there are plenty of good value hotels in this general area. Don't be fooled.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is true that the Cass is a "bare-bones" hotel, but it is clean, quiet with a location that can't be beat. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We had no problems with our room the four nights we were there. The Cass is located about 4 blocks from the closest CTA station (Grand), half a block from Blomingdale's Home store, and two blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The hotel was sold out when we were there and we met a lot of nice people during our stay. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor users hit a homer”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoBug
Reviews.Content: I read most of the TripAdvisor reviews of the Cass Hotel before booking two rooms for a stay Sept. 13-16. They were right on the mark. I was pleasantly surprised by the lobby -- no frills but check-in and check-out were smooth. The only drink and snack vending machines, ice machine, and internet connection are all in the lobby outside the Cass Cafe. The small cafe advertised an inexpensive continental breakfast daily, but we ate elsewhere. Also, the cafe closes at 1:30 daily. The elevators at the Cass are okay. I've seen much worse at four-star properties. The hallways were clean and quiet, although it's easy to hear loud conversations from rooms (if you're so inclined to listen in). That only happened a couple of times on our way to the elevator. The rooms were relatively small and very simple, as reviewed numerous times. The air conditioning worked perfectly, the beds were comfortable, and hot water was ready in seconds despite our location on the ninth floor. My wife brought her own towels, leaving me the hotel towels. Yes, they were thin, but two of them dried me just fine. My only regret was not being able to bypass the pay-for-internet connection in the lobby. I brought my laptop and phone cord, but our phone was hard-wired into the wall so there was no way to use that cord or substitute my own. Hey, three days without e-mail was actually nice. It reminded me of the old days -- the 90's. :-) We spent most of our waking time wandering the city, so the Cass was perfect. The money we saved on accommodations was put to good use on meals, Cubs tickets, and transportation. If William Shatner can't score me a nicer hotel for the same price, I'll gladly return to the Cass.

Reviews.Title: “Get More Than You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Arts-Critic
Reviews.Content: The Cass gets 5 *s from me for one simple reason: at its price it's a bargain. Complain if you like that the rooms are small, don't offer coffee-makers or clock radios, etc. The fact is that the rooms are kept clean, the beds are fully satisfactory, the water's always hot, & the staff is invariably helpful. You can get a continental breakfast for $1.99 in the lobby cafe every morning. If you need a hairdrier, you can get one from the front desk. Above all, this location can't be beat. I've stayed at various hotels in Chicago, & the Cass saved me at least $100 in transport costs during my 6 days there this past week. Add that to the $50-100 a night in room costs & figure that the Cass pays your entertainment costs for you. It's a steal of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place when all you need is a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on more than one occasion mainly because when I travel to Chicago with either my husband or friends, we're looking to spend our time and money out on the town enjoying ourselves. Not in our hotel room for the duration of the trip. This hotel is in an awesome location for people who are coming for shopping or site-seeing since its just a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue. The rooms are nice, clean and good-sized as well. The staff is also quite friendly and helpful. And for the price you simply cant pass it up. We recently got a deal on a room at the Palmer House and we were appauled at how small the room was. We needed one room for four people and this was a large closet! Even housekeeping seemed shocked at the size of the room when they brought extra pillows. And more than once we were snubbed by the staff at the Palmer House when we asked for assistance. So frankly, if you're looking to spend your vacation in the hotel room, maybe you want to shell out $300 or more on the room, but when I'm looking to see the town, I'm perfectly happy to save my money by staying at the Cass Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: arthi
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent the weekend in Chicago in July. We found the Cass Hotel at Tripadvisor and took the advice of the many positive reviews it had received. For $69 dollars a night it was exactly what we expected. No shampoo, thin towels, and a small outdated room. That being said, we did not go to Chicago to sit in our room all day. The Cass is located within walking distance of some of Chicago's best sights including the Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. After a long day of sightseeing it was nice to return to a clean comfortable room and a hot shower. If you're looking for luxury this isn't the hotel for you. If you're looking for a comfortable room with a convenient location at a bargain price, this is the hotel for you. Keep in mind that parking is expensive in Chicago. Parking for the Cass was around $19 a day and from what we saw of the rest of the Chicago hotels I think this is the norm. In all, we were very satisfied with our stay and would consider staying there again the next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the Bill!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the Cass Hotel on this website and read the reviews and decided to check it out. It was exactly as most had described: clean, NO frills, small, but price was excellent and location was even better. If you plan on spending most of your time outside the room this is a great choice. The sheets were clean and the bathroom was too. The shower had decent power and the TV worked. No complaints here. Perfectly located for sightseeing around downtown and an easy cab ride from Amtrak. Reminded me of a small European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review with the fact that I'm used to cheap accommodations. With the Cass, you get what you pay for. Curtains were falling apart, bathroom smelled of a ripe sewer (though it was unseasonably hot at the time), there was a smear of dead mosquitoes on the wall, and when I tried to take a shower, the water was brown with rust. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cass is Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Gawdpdx
Reviews.Content: My 4 night stay at the Cass was great. The room with 2 beds was plenty spacious and included a refrigerator. The air conditioner kept me cool and comfy in spite of the 95 degree days I got to "enjoy." Sure, the bathroom is small and the towels were kind of thin, but good enough to dry me off. The shower had good pressure. My room overlooked the garden of the historic house on Erie, around the corner. And I loved having a drink with the regulars in the Sea of Happiness Bar. If you can find a comparable hotel in the area, go for it, but I think you'll be hard-pressed to find one.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Cass twice, once in June, 2002, and just this month; both trips were for nearly a week each. I was pleased overall on both stays. The first year, I booked on line for $69. This time, the internet specials were not available, so I called and got a room with a King bed for $99. Other hotels were renting rooms at no less than about $299 during the same time period. My room was clean, furnishings OK, and even had a refrigerator. The lighting was not necessarily the best, and there was no shampoo. However, for $200 a day, I can buy a lot of shampoo! In fact, with that savings I could also buy a nice bath towel if I had so desired. And, I didn't rent the room to be awed by mood lighting! The location is excellent, with several good restaurants right in the area, and just 2 blocks from Michigan Ave. The room had no view, but it was very quiet since it was not facing the street. I have not ever seen anyone there that would fit the description of "undesirable". I will definitely stay at the Cass again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Budget, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: gec1211
Reviews.Content: We had been trying since January to find a reasonably priced hotel for our trip to Chicago in late May. Everything within reason was well over $200 for a convenient location. Since we don't have much room for compromise in the cleanliness category, we were reluctant to take a chance with a more economical two star hotel. After doing lots of research, we decided to take a chance on the Cass Hotel located two blocks off of North Michigan Avenue. Upon entering the lobby, we were really concerned about we had gotten ourselves into. There is absolutely no ambiance, few ammenities, and a very sparce feeling. Our room was pretty much the same and without any view. HOWEVER !!! it was as clean as a whistle. The room itself was fairly roomy, adequate bathroom, not one single odd aroma, freshly laundered bedspreads. The best part of our decision to stay here was that the location relative to what we had planned to do could not have been any better. If you're looking for a hotel with more than bare bones economy, don't waste your time. If you want a clean, convenient place to shower and sleep, this just might fit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus my aunt and college-age cousin, stayed at the Cass Hotel for three nights in early May, 2005. This is a great location, at a bargain price. My husband and I had a small room located next to the elevators on the 7th floor. It had one double bed. Although it was very small, it suited us just fine. We pretty much were only in the room to sleep and shower. It was clean, quiet, and had a window that opened. Our towels were a little on the thin and small side, but they were clean. We didn't actually turn on the TV but apparently they do have cable. My aunt and cousin had a room with 2 double beds, and their room was significantly larger, with two windows (again, one that opened). Again, it was clean and quiet, and they had no complaints. The front desk staff was friendly, especially the night desk guy. There is a small coffee shop that serves breakfast in the morning, which we didn't eat at. The Sea of Happiness lounge is indeed friendly! I think that they may be renovating the hotel, as we saw workers during our stay. If you stay here, walk around the corner to see the amazing and historic home that's right next door. Again, the price was right, the location was great, and it was clean and safe. It's not the Park Hyatt, but it's easy on the budget. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, clean $$ saver spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we vacation, we like to spend more $$ on outdoor activities than our room. This was the perfect place to crash -clean, comfy bed. We've stayed here twice, and the 2nd time they already had newer, softer towels and some renovated rooms. I love the authenticity of the building, and of course the LOCATION!! I recommend Cass Hotel if you plan on spending more time and money outdoors than indoors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: echomrg
Reviews.Content: The place might look a little shabby from outside, but it really has a great offer at a very convenient price, in an amazing location, a 10 minute walk from michigan av. and 3 minutes from the nearest CTA station. There's nothing "hip" in this hotel, everything is very simple and basic. But everything works perfectly. The staff is friendly and well disposed. The rooms are not big or luxurious, but are well equipped (with a big refrigerator and kitchenette), clean and confortable. They offered *free* wi-fi connection in the lobby. The cafeteria is a bit poor on the "looks side", but it offers a nice breakfast, cooked at the moment, for a very nice price (way less then your average starbucks). Two thumbs up for cass hotel! Marcello

Reviews.Title: “Great value and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cass Hotel Feb. 11-13 and I had no problems at all. I got a $59 "Winter Rate" and was smack dab in the middle of everything. At first I was dismayed by how small and plain my room was but then I walked out to see the city. The employees were friendly and helpful and I would recommend this place to anybody. Why spend the extra cash at the fancier hotels when you could spend it three blocks over on the Magnificent Mile?

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: yellowpigs
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give the Cass a great review for fear that people may catch on and then my little get away place in Chicago may be discovered and it may not be as easy to get a room. BUT, they deserve the props after some nit-picky people gave it such stinky reviews. I have stayed at Cass twice and definitely plan to go back. The cheap price and great location make it a must for anyone traveling on a budget, especially the younger crowd looking for a place to shack after they party downtown. It is within walking distance to basically anywhere you would want to go. You may have to take a taxi to get to some clubs, but my sister and I walked to White Star and surrounding areas with no problems. Seriously though, what do some people expect to get from a $87 room in downtown Chicago. The accomodations are far from luxurious. I suggest bringing soap and shampoo. No samples here. Maybe you should bring a towel too. I think they mistake hand towels for bath towels. Anyhow, if you are looking to party it up and don't plan on spending the day/weekend holed up in your room, then check out Cass. Just try to keep it a secret. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cass Hotel- A Chicago Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't speak to the experiences of some of the people who gave poor reviews of the Cass Hotel here on TripAdvisor, but I've stayed at the Cass Hotel a couple of times with the most recent stay being one week in length and I can recommend it. What comes to mind when I first stepped foot in this hotel was " Europe " as this hotel reminded me of pretty much every inexpensive hotel I stayed in during my trips to Europe(especially the City Panzio Ring Hotel in Budapest, Hungary). The Cass Hotel has basic amenities so don't expect too much beyond what you are paying. On-line, we booked our room for about $65/night for the week and I think we got our money's worth. We didn't stay at the Cass Hotel for the " views out of our room window " ( I've stayed in $250/night rooms in downtown Chicago and had views of trash dumpsters and parking lots) or for their range of services(no spas here) or for their dining accommodations. We stayed at the Cass Hotel because of the location. You're not going to find anything at that price in that location in Downtown Chicago. Location, Location, Location. That's what the Cass Hotel is all about. The rooms are as clean as any cut-rate lodging chain(Red Roof Inn, Motel 6, etc.) so I am not certain why any of the reviewers would write that the rooms are " filthy, dirty, etc. " as we didn't see any of that during our stays. During our last stay and because we stayed a week, the Cass Hotel upgraded us to a room with a king-sized bed. We had a TV, air conditioner, heater, and refrigerator in our room. Our room with the king size bed looked just like the room pictured on the web site. There are basic laundry facilities and Internet access on the main floor. The towels are a bit industrial and thin/rough......but they are clean. Our room was cleaned(fresh sheets, towels, trash removed, etc.) daily and we had no issue with this or with the room not being clean. The area is one of the safest in downtown Chicago as well. So if you are looking for just the basic lodging amenities and are coming to Chicago to explore downtown, I can recommend the Cass Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cass 12-10-2004. I read the reviews on this site and decided to give it a try. We were in town for the weekend and were out sight seeing and shopping most of the time. We had a good experience. The rooms are small but they are clean, quiet, and the location is tough to beat. It is true that the towels are small, thin, and scratchy. Wouldn't be a bad idea to bring an extra one with you. I think if you plan to stay at this hotel you need to understand it is not the Ritz and you will not be disappointed. If you want a fancy hotel with a large room and plan to spend alot of time in your room, you may want to find another hotel. I would stay at the Cass again.

Reviews.Title: “was just OK”
Reviews.Author: rickwal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cass Mid November, the location is excellent, just 2 blocks from Michagan Avenue and within walking distance of Navy Pier, Hancock Centre etc. The hotel has a dorm feel to it, Reception is very bare and un welcoming, they mixed our booking up and gave us (2 guys) a small double room, we asked to be moved but they would not budge and after 2 days (of a 4 day stay) we had to accept it. The room we were in was a bit dingy and had stained carpeting and lampshade. Towels in the bathroom were scratchy and small, the cafe is only open in the morning so when you arrive after a long flight you have to then venture out to find something to eat. The Sea of Happiness bar is ok, Laura the bartender was very friendly and the Beer extremely reasonable. I would recommend this hotel for a stopover of if you are on a tight budget but next time I would prefer to pay the extra and stay somewhere confortable - and with friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, greater value!”
Reviews.Author: kerry-okie
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER pay $150 plus for a room in downtown Chicago again. The Cass Hotel is in a great location, just a short walk from Michigan Avenue shopping, at maybe half the price of most downtown hotels. This is not a luxury hotel but our room was clean and suited our needs, a clean place to sleep and shower! We stopped off in the hotel bar, "Captain George's Sea of Happiness Lounge" (what a great name) downstairs and had a drink. A small, no frills place with a good jukebox and Laura the bartender took good care of us. The front desk staff was VERY friendly and I would recommend the Cass Hotel to anyone. Especially those who don't want to spend a lot of money. You can park your car at the parking garage next door and have your ticket validated at the Cass front desk. Discounted rate of $19 a day but we paid $35 a day for parking at another downtown hotel. The Cass is close to so many stores (you can see Nordstrom from the hotel) and restaurants and there are 2 Redline El stops within a short walking distance if you want to venture outside of downtown. I wished I would have known about the Cass Hotel before blowing all kinds of money on big name, big price Chicago hotels. My experience at the Cass was excellent and I have already booked a room for my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It has no ammenities and looks a little sketchy when you first enter but the rooms were immaculate and the location is prime. Don't be scared off this place will work nicely if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Cass is just fine!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reveiws for the Cass Hotel, I was a little worried that we were going to stay in some kind of crack den, bum hotel with cockroaches the size of small dogs.....far from it....the room was clean, spacious and bath was recently updated. Was it the Drake or the Four Seasons, no, but for the price it was perfect...the location was close to everything and i will stay there again. As for the itchy towels, ours were big, clean and fluffy. If you are a big snob, go to the Drake, we won't miss you at the Cass.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little leery about staying at the Cass. Having stayed there about 6 years ago, before renovations, my memory of the rooms was not so great: dingy overall, with stained up carpeting and an ancient sink in the bathroom. However, I need not have worried. For $84 a night on 4th of July weekend in the heart of downtown Chicago, the room was fine! Everything is updated and fairly new, and we even had a little fridge! The staff was friendly and the cafe was reasonable. Even the towels were not that bad! :-) For the price and location, I certainly can't complain. I would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “If you value your life, do not stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: FOR ALL WHO READ THISâ€¦HEED THE WARNINGS! After finding the Cass hotel online, we knew it would not be five star accommodations, but the location looked good and the hotel was cheap ($94). We saw some of the negative reviews but gave it the benefit of the doubt. The rooms are tiny, dirty and disgusting. And yes, the towels are very thin and scratchy. To elaborate here is an account of the nine horrible hours we stayed at the Cass Hotel: After seeing the rooms, we complained and were moved up to the â€œsuitesâ€� on the 16th floor. They will not tell you that they have the suitesâ€¦they are reserved for the managerâ€™s family in case they come into town. The suites were actually nice with remodeled bathrooms. The pictures on the website are of suites and not the regular rooms. When we arrived one of the two elevators was being worked on. Later that evening, after it was supposedly fixed, it dropped five floors when we were in it. Shortly after someone else was stuck in it. Yet, we stayed onâ€¦ Even later that evening, as we got ready to go out, we noticed the fire trucks pulling up in front of the hotel. However, the smoke alarms were not going off, and we assumed it was for the person stuck in the elevator. Luckily, one of the girls went out in the hallway and smelled the smoke. After walking down sixteen flights of stairs we found out the water heater in the basement caught fire. We may have given the hotel one last chance if the situation was not handled so poorly. The management did not address the situation, no one said, â€œWe are sorry, but the fire has been extinguished, you may now return to you rooms.â€� The front desk proceeded to check in other guests through all of this. After returning to our room, to pack up our belonging, we checked out the smoke detectors, which lacked one important itemâ€¦a battery. This is the point we relocated to the lovely Holiday Inn â€“ Navy Pier ($149). Paying the extra $50 was definitely worth it for piece of mind. IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 Days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cass with 13 English students the 15th and 16th April 2004. I had read the reviews before leaving for Chicago but went with an open mind. We found the Hotel clean, very good position. the staff efficient and friendly. The cafe on ground floor was very useful and offers a good value breakfast gmenu. Our only complaint would be that the towels are a bit thin. But overall the hotel is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Cass Hotel: Great Location - Best downtown Chicago Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cass Hotel for several nights in September and November 2003 for a examination. Cass has a great location next to bloomingdales and many fancy restaurants. A large grocery store(Jewel Osco) is just a block away (ask for temp customer preferred card). Just off Michigan avenue and around the corner from Su Casa, Heaven on Seven, Water tower, etc. The building is "quit" old, but charming. The room itself was decent size, the bathrooom was small but clean. The hotel was quiet, reasonable priced (69.00 internet rate). The hotel had a small bar that was busy, but more the packpacker style. The hotel's coffee shop serves a limited menu that is basic and reasonable. Hotel service was quite good, after several tries I have even received a larger room due to heating problems. A coin operated laundry facilities are on site and available for guests to use. Internet is available for some dollars, but I used the showroom-computers in the Apple Store on Michigan Avenue. To wrap it up, the Cass is a good choice for people who wants to live downtown Chicago and prefer to spend their money on the Michigan avenue and not on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: millercgr
Reviews.Content: You'd think for the inexpensive price of a room, that the Cass would be a sleazy downtown Chicago hotel. Wrong. It's cozy and charming (though rooms are quite small), and in a great location in the heart of Chicago on a quiet street. Go anywhere else in Chicago and you'll pay three times as much for the same service and location. Only real complaint is the TV's are too high and close to the ceiling. Real atmospheric diner in the lobby serves some good grub. Also, I left my camera film at the hotel after checking out, and had absolutely no problem having the Cass ship it to my home for free! Kudos to the Cass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned to England from the Cass Hotel, Chicago where I was in town for the Bob Dylan shows. This is one of the best American hotels I have stayed in for location and value for money. It cost $273 (including tax) for three people for three nights in a room with three beds. The room was large enough for the three of us not to feel cramped and was very clean. You can get a good breakfast in the small cafe. Best of all is the Sea of Happiness Lounge. This is great bar with draught beer at $2.50. If you call in be sure to say hello to the Captain. The Cass doesn't have the facilities of some of the other larger chains but for price and location it can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “kiwi experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For value i would give this 3 stars. The positives are, great location, and quiet. The negatives which regretably out-weigh the positives were (1) rude staff, (2) cleanliness way below par (3) internet available but didn't work most of the time (4) accommodation very small (5) again staff unhelpful when asking for assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine... great deal in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm always skeptical of outright terrible reviews that are sprinkled among otherwise decent write-ups of a hotel. For instance, when someone mentioned seeing protistutes in the lobby, my BS meter went off. Surely, it wasn't that bad, right? Right. The Cass Hotel is, simply put, a good deal on a modest hotel in a good area of town. It's within a few blocks of an El stop, there are plenty of good (non-chain) restaurants just down the block, and the hotel itself provided what you'd expect for the money, and a little more. Yes, the towels are thin, but the room we had was just fine for the four of us. The bathroom was small but clean, the cleaning staff did a great job each day, and our floor was quiet. The Cafe was cheap and accessible and the front desk staff was very accomodating keeping our five bags behind the desk after we checked out. I think a lot of people are expecting too much -- you're not going to get five-star accomodations for $80 or less a night in the center of Chicago. But if you're not counting on having room service for dinner, the Cass will serve you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with no frills”
Reviews.Author: capitalgull
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cass for four nights early in November and thought it to be great value for money in a downtown area. Having found that same gruff guy on check-in, found the room to be adequate, fairly quiet and clean enough. You really do get what you pay for. Have to agree the towels are poor, but the bathroom is clean and for the money, the Cass is a fine choice. The bar downstairs is lively as well. And the location is tremendous, just two blocks from the Magnificent Mile and everything you need is nearby. If you go expecting the Ritz you will be disappointed, if not, you'll be just fine at the Cass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: taboba
Reviews.Content: The location was great. the staff could not have been nicer and knew how to get everywhere and had some great tips on places to eat. The rooms were very small, but quite clean. the bed was too soft. some rooms have a view of a brick wall. (ours had a nice view & a window that actually opened).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cass, a Holiday Inn Express
HotelInfo.Address: 640 N Wabash Ave, Chicago, IL 60611
